results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.


Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time. I have very limited access to the internet and that can make it difficult for me to respond to emails. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

These classes are not affiliated with any church or religion.

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind

· Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power

· Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships

· Learn to work constructively with your own emotions

· Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities

· Develop new resources and capabilities

· Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.

Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.

Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses

Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.

Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.

Discover the passion and power that resides within you

Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind

We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.

Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

Ah, the Variety Show. Remember Ed Sullivan, Sonny and Cher, etc? Get a few acts together - a singer, a comic, a few dancers, well, maybe a few burlesque dancers, throw in a snake charmer, and you have a marvelous evening of entertainment. A little song, a little dance, a little seltzer down your pants: just the prescription for an entertaining evening.

Come join us in Davis Square for one of those marvelous evenings of entertainment:

On the first Tuesday of every month there is a rollicking showcase chock full of the best burlesque, variety, and outlandish foolishness in Boston.

They've got stars from near and far doing the acts that made them infamous.

The Teaseday Club is an evening of out-of-this-world vaudeville moderne featuring fringe performers from the local, national, and international stage.

You can also sip creative cocktails from our expert mixologists (or just slam a cheap beer) and rub elbows with our elegant attendees and practically perfect performers.

The Teaseday Club meets the first Tuesday of every month at The Davis Square Theater and tickets are $10 in advance or $15 at the box office.

http://www.teaseday.com/

To guarantee admission, please buy your tickets in advance. Let me know you've got a ticket, and let me know your last name, and I'll have you seated together with us.

Join us for some of Boston’s funniest comedians, sexiest burlesque dancers, and weirdest, wildest, and most wonderful performers of all stripes!

$10 in advance; $15 week of show. Age limit: 18+

We are meeting every Tuesday night from 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM practicing Modern Arnis, WC, and SCJ flow drills and Self-Defense skills.

All levels are welcome!  For ages 15 and up.


The price is $15.00 /per person /per meetup. The first meetup is free.

Please wear loose fitting, comfortable cloths suitable for working out.

Please do not wear shoes that you've worn outdoors on the wood floor.



Instructor's Background

Alix Lavaud has been training Martial Arts for over 45 years and is a master of Modern Arnis, Pien San Wing Chun Kung Fu, and has extensive training in Small Circle Jujitsu.  He also humbly owns the rank of Lakan Apat (a 4th degree BLACKBELT ).


Lineage

Modern Arnis :  Remy Presas  -->  Alix Lavaud

Wing Chun:  Henry Mui  -->  Alix Lavaud

Small Circle Jujitsu:  Wally Jay -->  Alix Lavaud


Philosophy

 Go With The Flow ...

Some Quotes we Love

“If your mind is empty, it is ready for anything. In the beginner’s mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert’s there are few”
― Shunryu Suzuki


“Everything is perfect and there is always room for improvement.”
― Shunryu Suzuki

“We must exist right here and right now!”
― Shunryu Suzuki

Benefits of Martial Arts

1.  Mental Benefits

2.  Improved Balance

3.  Improved Flexibility

4.  Focus and stillness

5.  Hand and Eye Coordination

6.  Improved reflexes

7.  Learn self-defense skills

8.  Stress relief

9.  Relax

10.  Gain Self Confident and Self Respect

11.  Learn to Breathe

12.  Learn to Find Focus and Stillness

13.  Encouraging Non-Violent Conflict Resolution

14.  Improvement in many other Areas of Life

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
We need to get the following information into the hands of EVERY DIRECTOR of a KILL SHELTER in the US as well as BOARD MEMBERS and supporters of those shelters.   Due to a generous grant from a supporter, the NO KILL ADVOCACY CENTER (not to be confused w/organizations with similar names) is making the following offer. We need YOUR HELP! Please post to the Facebook page of EVERY KILL "Shelter" you can think of- as well as every pro-animal group.  Please also email info to shelter directors & board members of Kill "shelters" (contact info below).   Please make it clear that you are NOT a member of any group but are writing as a private citizen.   IMPORTANT:  Always be extremely polite & assume they will stop the killing once they understand how it can be done.

We CAN SEE a NO KILL AMERICA in our lifetimes!
---

FREE to a GOOD (or bad) SHELTER

Are you a SHELTER DIRECTOR? Attorney Nathan Winograd, former Director of Operations for the SF SPCA and Director of the No Kill Advocacy Center, would like to show you- FREE - how ANY SHELTER can become NO KILL - while TURNING A HEFTY PROFIT! For your FREE COPY of the book "REDEMPTION- the No Kill Revolution in America" as well as a your FREE CD with over 200 documents, including “how to” guides, sample policies and procedures that will guide you, step by step, in implementing this proven model, please send a letter on official letterhead to:

No Kill Advocacy Center
6114 La Salle Ave. #837
Oakland CA 94611

The fine print: No emails. U.S. addresses only. Only one per shelter. Under the terms of the grant, this offer does not apply to foster-based rescue groups. While supplies last. For a schedule of screenings of documentary film REDEMPTION: The No Kill Revolution in America (based on the book), please go to www.nokill.org

Note:  (copied from original discussion on August's "virtual event"): a list of the 10 highest kill shelters is available here:   http://www.advocateforsavingdogs.org/highkillshelterslist.html

I posted on lots of sites and wrote the director of a shelter in Augusta, GA - will continue on down the list. I think it might be good strategy, though, to start with the shelters in your town and then state. You go to webpages to find staff members and mail them. I would cc several people at a shelter- my logic being that maybe *one* will be receptive. We can also email members on the boards of directors

PLEASE:  remember to be extremely polite, and always assume the directors are just not aware of the no-kill model and would certainly implement it if they knew how.

IMPORTANT:  Please make it clear that you are writing as a private citizen, and not as part of an organized effort

For more discussion on which states have been covered, etc, please see original discussion at august's virtual "save lives" event.

WE CAN DO THIS!
results.name: SAVE LIVES!

results.description:
Today’s global community is experiencing rapid change, intellectual expansion, and uncertainty. These equate to a multitude of challenges that require rethinking how we are creative, how we learn, and how we make tomorrow. There is strategy, discipline, and skill involved when it comes to creativity, and it can be oriented and optimized for results.

This intensive CIC workshop is designed to enable changemaking entrepreneurs and corporate leaders to learn, practice and discover unexpected perspectives. It hones creative skillsets which are rooted in the arts and which aid in observation, analysis, and problem-solving as differentiating strategies for leading change.

Participants will unlock ways to make deeper and broader observations, building trust in uncertainty and challenging assumptions and conventional strategies. As individuals and in groups, they will experiment with researched methods for harnessing creativity and creative processes that expand your way of thinking.

The program delivers key elements from MIT Sloan’s Innovation Period top-rated leadership course as a sequence of three 1-hr sessions. It will begin with a talk about the strategies and decision-making behind the evolution of art giants. Roll up your sleeves in Session 2 for hands-on immersion in researched processes that free your thinking and discover methods for streaming creativity. For Session 3, participants depart for the Museum of Fine Arts Huntington. They will convene at the Huntington Street entrance (right across the MFA T-stop on the 'E' Green Line) to resume from 4:15-5pm for a far from conventional tour and exercises that dive deep into decision-making from the maker’s perspective.


Aithan Shapira MFA PhD works with business, social and art influencers to change the way things get done by changing how we see and orienting creativity for results. He prototypes with Fortune 500 and entrepreneurial innovation teams and redesigns leadership development, culture and systems for success (and failure) using research on creative process collected across the arts and distilled over 14 years from the Royal College of Art and Design to living with Aboriginal Australians studying innovation in cultures of survival. At MIT Sloan, Aithan is pioneering workshops, courses, and developing emergent research where art and business meet in leadership development, creative renewal and talent retention, progressive prototyping and systems, culture, and behavior-shifting. He has designed programming for MIT Media Lab, the launch of MIT’s Hacking Arts, Berklee Institute for Creative Entrepreneurship, is a participant at Summit Series and HATCH. His TEDx Talk looked at creativity through a kaleidoscope. Aithan also co-founded limeSHIFT and The Global Institute for the Arts and Leadership, startups out of MIT at the juncture of business, art, and social enterprise. He is also critic/lecturer at the Museum School of Fine Arts, and in his own studio, he draws, paints, and sculpts as an internationally-exhibiting artist. Aithan stays up at night striving to collaborate on teams hatching arts-based experiences that activate and multiply creative results to drive urgent global progress.

"My work is not about me; it is a mirror of us, and it does not show what we are but reflects what we can become.” -Shapira

 In 2012, he gave a TEDx talk entitled We Are All Cubists, in which he explored multiple perspectives and the way we view both history and the present. Aithan currently lives with his wife and daughter in Boston, MA, where he has a studio. He teaches at the School of the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, and gives an intensive drawing course at MIT.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PET_Bez8EsE
results.how_to_find_us: Check in with security in the lobby of the 1 Broadway building, take the elevators up to the 14th floor. There, concierge can direct you.

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 


Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill
Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street
Mission Hill, Roxbury
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops)
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"!
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).


We arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share'
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort. 
TALK with us FIRST !!

Looking for Gifted Marketers to 
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and 
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas

Vegan Cooking Classes or  
Learning How to Prepare Vegan Food
(using the $2 bag of produce as a low-cost start) 


What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag?

Portion Control

Avocados!!!

results.description:
You are invited to attend:
Our Happy Hours are targeted towards entrepreneurs, small business owners, investors, and people looking to network with Coalition members. We have all sorts of beers, chips, dip, and N64 games! We would love to meet you, have a conversation, play some Mario Kart, or just have a laugh!

Coalition: Boston is a flexible office and coworking hub for small businesses and startups. Located in the center of Downtown Boston, we are a strong, close-knit community of entrepreneurs, investors, and professionals who love to celebrate Hump Day on Wednesdays.

Thank you to our Sponsor, First Republic Bank!

Founded in 1985, First Republic and its subsidiaries offer private banking, private business banking and private wealth management, including investment, trust and brokerage services. First Republic specializes in delivering exceptional, relationship-based service, with a solid commitment to responsiveness and action. Services are offered through preferred banking or wealth management offices primarily in San Francisco, Palo Alto, Los Angeles, Santa Barbara, Newport Beach, San Diego, Portland, Palm Beach, Boston, Greenwich, and New York City. First Republic offers a complete line of banking products for individuals and businesses, including deposit services, as well as residential, commercial and personal loans.

Thank you to our Annual Sponsor, Botkeeper!

Botkeeper does everything a bookkeeper can do, only faster, 24/7, with more reporting, beautiful dashboards, and at a fraction of the cost. With the use of software and machine learning, botkeeper automates much of the day to day data entry, classification, and aggregation of information into reports and dashboards. Unlike a traditional bookkeeper, botkeeper is continuously improving and becoming more efficient over time, leading to amazing scalability and big savings for our clients. Knowing it is impossible to automate everything, all botkeeper clients are paired with a dedicated botkeeper CPA to provide a personal touch, advice, and quality assurance.

FAQs

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? You must present an ID to security to gain access to the building. 21+ event.

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event? We are located right above the Downtown Crossing T stop, part of the Red and Orange lines, and one stop away from the Green line at Park Street. Garage parking options can be found here: www.coalitionspace.com/parking

Can I bring a friend? We'd be dissapointed if you didn't. But if you don't have any friends, you can make some here! :)

What if I have a nut allergy? We have Klondike bars!
results.name: Coalition's HAPPY HOUR sponsored by First Republic Bank!

results.description:
Who should join: Beginners to Advanced speakers interested in learning how to improve their public speaking for fun or professionally.  Reduce your fear and increase your confidence.


Why  members should join: Learn the basics of public speaking, challenge your current skills to be a professional speaker or just to have fun & meet interesting people.  You will also be challenged to give more challenging types of speeches such as ice breakers, humorous and inspirational speeches.

What members can expect out of the group: We have a fast paced 1 hour meeting packed with 2 prepared speeches from members as well as Table Topics where anyone is invited to speak on a suggested topic for 1-2 minutes to hone their ability to speak off the cuff.


You can also join our mentorship program and be assigned an advanced speaker who will guide you to improving your skills.

Lead meetings and presentations at work, begin your path to being a better teacher or professional paid public speaker or simply be a better storyteller.

Tuesday 12pm meeting for members and guests. Please visit for free! 

All are welcome.

results.description:
Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. 

• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal ("Boston 1 - Join us") or venmo (@boston1dboat).</a>

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ll2NR3MZbV3O7ZrmPdZsCbKRaC_G8KKa7lwBUlC59Pk/viewform?c=0&w=1">"Boston 1 e-waiver" 

• Make sure to check our Facebook,</a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab. 
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards. 

• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended. 

• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $5 flat rate. Weekdays $8 flat rate (in after 3pm). More details can be found here: http://bit.ly/1Nxv1lw.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Wednesday Water training

results.description:
Topic:  PowerShell + Azure

Presenter: Gene Laisne

Gene will go over using PowerShell to access and manipulate Azure. Over the course of the evening Gene will demonstrate creating VMs in Azure with PowerShell along with discussions of key topics such as Virtual Networks and Resource Groups. We'll get setup from a bare Windows 10 system. We'll also look at Resource Group templates and how to get up and running even faster.

Directions:  Please come to the main entrance of 1 Cambridge Center, located at the corner of Broadway and Main streets.  Proceed to the second floor and check in with reception.  You will be directed to the elevators towards the back of the space.  Go to the fourth floor.

Parking:  Meters don’t require payments past 8pm.  Meters have a 2 hour limit, so if you can find a meter around 6pm you'll be good for the night.  There are several pay lots including Standard Parking at 1 Broadway Street or the Marriot parking lot.  The MIT lots are NOT free, and while many people park there the school reserves the right to tow and ticket.

See the section at the bottom of the page titled

"Parking at MIT without a Permit".

http://web.mit.edu/facilities/transportation/parking/visitors/public_parking.html
results.how_to_find_us: www.WindowsBoston.org
results.name: Monthly Windows Boston Meeting - PowerShell + Azure

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the unpaved municipal parking lot to the left of 72 Jefferson Street
results.name: Marlborough Couch to 5K - Spring 2016

results.description:
Hey kickballers!

You know how much I hate to call off kickball. Especially when it looks like we would have enough people to play! Unfortunately, I don't think it would be a good idea to play today, due to (1) impending rain, (2) temps in the 40s accompanying that rain with substantial wind, and (3) nowhere to quickly take shelter if a cold downpour happens.


We have played through light rain before - but it's usually a good deal warmer than the 40s when we've done this. And even if it isn't raining when we start, rain becomes more likely after 6, and I don't want anyone getting sick.

Angel had the idea to go to Cornwall's as a backup plan, a restaurant/bar in Kenmore Square with pool tables (and boardgames also, I hear) so that all is not lost for those of us still wanting some social time. I like this idea, so I've changed the meetup details accordingly. I'll be there at 6 to greet any kickball faithful. My number is[masked] if you need to send me a message, or post a comment on the meetup.

--Mitch

Hi Ladies:

Spring is around the corner.  We ran this program with great success the last few years.  This is for members with little or no experience that want to take a "swing" at learning and playing golf.

This is for a small group to get together to take some "group lessons", the group size would be minimum of 6 maximum of 10.    I have gotten us an incredible DEAL!!!!  5 weeks of classes at $100.00 PER PERSON!!!  

WE WILL OFFER THIS TO OUR NSWG MEMBERS FIRST.  IF THERE ARE ANY SPOTS AVAILABLE AFTER A WEEK, WE WILL OPEN SPOTS UP TO GUEST.

IF ALL SPOTS FILL AND WE HAVE ENOUGH INTEREST I WILL CHECK INTO A SECOND GROUP.

THIS YEAR YOU NEED TO CALL THE GOLF COURSE[masked] GOLF SHOP, TELL THEM YOU ARE WITH SUE'S NORTH SHORE WOMEN'S GROUP ....YOU MAKE PAYMENT TO THEM DIRECTLY.  YOUR SPOT IS ONLY SECURED ONCE YOU MAY PAYMENT!

Do the math ladies that is $20/per lesson!!!!

FIRST COME FIRST SERVE!!! (with secured payment to the golf club!)

Wednesday's, Starting on April 27th 6pm (for 5 weeks)

Non refundable  (if weather looks iffy you can call the course and ask it the class will be running, if cancelled class will be added to the end).

Hillview Golf Course is a regulation 18-hole golf course that is town owned by North Reading and managed by Golf Facilities Management, Inc. Hillview is a course where players of all levels will have a wonderful golfing experience, challenging for the expert and playable for the beginner. The player friendly course plays to 5773 yards from the blue tees, 5290 from the white tees, and 4521 from the red tee markers at which par is 69. Golfers will feel comfortable off the tee and will be challenged with their approach shots requiring precise shots into the greens.

results.description:
6-6:30pm - News, announcements, job postings, etc.

7-~8pm - Main presentation & Q/A

There are a number of reasons to use source code to assist in web application penetration testing such as making better use of penetration testers’ time, providing penetration testers with deeper insight into system behavior, and highlighting specific sections of so development teams can remediate vulnerabilities faster. Examples of these are provided using the open source ThreadFix plugin for the OWASP ZAP proxy and dynamic application security testing tool. These show opportunities attendees have to enhance their own penetration tests given access to source code.

This presentation covers the “ABCs” of source code assisted web application penetration testing: covering issues of attack surface enumeration, backdoor identification, and configuration issue discovery. Having access to the source lets an attacker enumerate all of the URLs and parameters an application exposes – essentially its attack surface. Knowing these allows pen testers greater application coverage during testing. In addition, access to source code can help to identify potential backdoors that have been intentionally added to the system. Comparing the results of blind spidering to a full attack surface model can identify items of interest such as hidden admin consoles or secret backdoor parameters. Finally, the presentation examines how access to source code can help identify configuration settings that may have an adverse impact on the security of the deployed application.

Dan Cornell is a globally recognized application security expert, Dan Cornell holds over 15 years of experience architecting, developing and securing web-based software systems. As the Chief Technology Officer and a Principal at Denim Group, Ltd., he leads the technology team to help Fortune 500 companies and government organizations integrate security throughout the development process. He is also the original creator of ThreadFix, Denim Group's industry leading application security program management platform. Cornell was Principal Investigator as Denim Group researched and developed the Hybrid Analysis Mapping (HAM) technology that lies at the heart of ThreadFix, through a Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) contract with the Department of Homeland Security's Science and Technology Directorate.

More information at: http://www.denimgroup.com/about_team_dan.html
results.name: The ABCs of Source-Assisted Web Application Penetration Testing With OWASP ZAP:

results.description:
Colonial Americans liked to drink — a lot. When the Mayflower set sail, it was loaded with beer; taverns were often the first structures built in a new village or town; John Adams began each day with a tankard of hard cider; and long before he became a whiskey distiller, George Washington’s recipe for ‘small beer’ was renowned. Beer, wine, cider, rum, Madeira, applejack, mead, and dozens of proto-cocktails filled mugs and glasses from dawn ’til dusk, before battle and long after. Join Corin Hirsch, author of Forgotten Drinks of Colonial New England, for a lively discussion of what our colonial forebears drank, where they drank, and how robust colonial drinking culture shaped our early identity. Afterwards, please join us for a special rum tasting and reception with the speaker hosted by Privateer Rum.

Corin Hirsch is a food and drinks writer in New York’s Hudson Valley, and has extensively covered the farm-to-bottle revival in New England for Seven Days and other publications.


Free but reservations are necessary. Click here to reserve your ticket.

Event run by the Old North Foundation
results.name: A Necessary Haze: Drinking in Colonial America

I will happily belay those who have not climbed before up until 7 PM, but then it's really important to know how to belay and to take the belay test that starts at 7 PM. You can rejoin the group after taking the belay test.

For those of you who already know how to belay, no need to take the class, you just need to pass this gym's belay test when you arrive.

Membership: $89/month

Adult Day Pass: $22 

Gear (shoes, harness, belay device): $8 ($5 for members)

Belay class: $15 (free for members)

We will meet at the cluster of cubbies on the first floor at 6:30 PM, greet each other, make sure everyone has a group or person to climb with then head off to climb. I'm looking into whether there is a place nearby to grab a bite or drink at the end of the night. If you have a place in mind, please let me know.

I'll send a message letting you know what color shirt and pants I am wearing incase you arrive late and want to search for us. I will also swing by the cubbies every 15 minutes until everyone who signed up has arrived. So, if you are not able to make it or are running late, PLEASE COMMUNICATE on this event's chat or by contacting my cell-phone, which I will send out once you are confirmed for the event.

Hope you can make it! I'm looking forward to meeting more climbers in the area.

~Avery~

results.description:
Join us for the 2nd installment of our quarterly career workshop series co-hosted with Startup Institute!


At the last workshop, Planning Your Path, we focused on discovering and planning your ideal career progression; this time, we'll focus on negotiation and making sure that you're not only fulfilled by your work, but that you get paid for doing it! 

About this Workshop

Allan Telio, Director of Startup Institute Boston, will walk you through a series of exercises that will help you discover what drives you, makes you feel fulfilled, and how adding negotiation to your tool belt leads to success.

You’ll learn the art of negotiation, practice using it, and leave with the confidence to achieve your goals.

Cost

The $5 registration fee for this workshop will be donated to the Girl Develop It scholarship fund, which helps students with a financial hardship attend GDI classes. Due to the  transaction and labor costs of processing refunds, we are not able to offer refunds for this workshop.

Workshop Learning Objectives 

• Why negotiation matters

• How to negotiate

• Role-playing of negotiation tactics

• Negotiation for appropriate salary expectations

Your Instructor

Allan Telio Vice President + Program Director, Boston Startup Institute

Allan is responsible for helping run the Boston Startup Institute program as well as building company-wide operations.  He's built teams for EnerNOC and Belkin international. Most recently he was the Vice President of Business Development for MyEnergy, which was acquired by Nest Labs.  In his spare time, he likes to make ice cream and bake bread for his wife Katie and his children, Lucy and Eli.


A job is what you do to earn money, a career is something you dedicate your life to. Without focus, a career can become a series of jobs—being bounced around by other people’s needs, wills, and expectations.

—Allan Telio, Startup Institute

results.description:
Barry will introduce us to the primary evidence that as quantum physics explains, consciousness creates the brain, and the brain does not create consciousness as previously believed. The presentation will be more "good news" that we have been "Beggars At God's Banquet," unaware we are creators, and thus unaware of our incredible powers.
About Barry:

Barry Harris majored in quantum physics in college, attended a “New Universe” workshop taught by David Bohm (one of the most significant theoretical physicists of the 20th century), and Karl Pribram (who showed the brain as the decoder of holograms), and took a weeklong course with Karl Pribram’s graduate student assistant.

Barry also worked at the Hippocrates Institute in Boston, writing health booklets for Dr. Ann Wigmore, discoverer of wheatgrass and founder of the live food movement. Hippocrates Institute is a unique healing center with a powerful spiritual focus, and an extreme dietary regime which often attracted clients who Western medicine had labeled terminally ill. While there Barry witnessed many miraculous recoveries.

Later Barry witnessed more miracles while working for four years in various centers around the U.S. founded by Viktoras Kulvinskas, Dr. Wigmore's Director. Obsessed with the secret to miracles, Barry did 20 years of independent research connecting quantum physics to Energy Medicine, cellular biology, neurophysiology, mind/body medicine, effect of emotions on health, etc.

Barry's research has been the source for the course "Beggars At God's Banquet: Miracles Are Our Birthright" which he has been presenting for the past nine years. Barry's book "Beggars At God's Banquet" based on the contents of the course will be published by X-Libris Publishing in the spring.

Barry is also a singer/voice teacher who teaches "Voice as a Path of Spiritual and Emotional Healing". His voice students learn the relationship of ego to breath patterns, and how to surrender control to a higher power. Barry is qualified to teach about miracles, because he had his own miracle. He restored his singing voice by recognizing the need for spiritual grace and surrender of control to a higher power, after Western doctors said he had damaged his voice beyond repair.
Barry can be reached at [masked], phone[masked]
results.name: Brain's Neuroplasticity and Miracles of Physical Healings with Barry Harris

results.description:
Join the Boston Austrian Economics Group as we embark upon Chapter 21: Work and Wages, from the Austrian classic; "Human Action: A Treatise on Economics," by Ludwig von Mises. The group will discuss the weekly reading and questions.

Please note the readings are not required to attend our meeting, but are recommended. As always, anyone interested in economics is welcome.

Fuji has plenty of free parking in the big garage and is accessible via the Orange Line "Assembly" stop.

Please feel free to call Andrew at (917)[masked], with any questions.

READING: 

Human Action, Part 4, Chapter 21: Work and Wages

Study Guide to Human Action by Robert P. Murphy

STUDY QUESTIONS:

1.) What is meant by "introversive" labor and "extroversive" labor?

2.) Why does catallactics only examine extroversive labor? 

3.) Why can't ideology affect the disutility of labor?

4.) What do labor and commodities have in common?

5.) How is the height of wage rates determined? How does this differ from the market price of commodities?

6.) Why do wage rates tend toward the marginal product of the kind of labor in question?

7.) What is meant by gross wage rates? In what way are they important for the employee?

8.) Why is the concept of the "iron law of wages" futile?

9.) In what ways does the uncertainty of the future affect the employee?

10.) Why is the worker subject to the supremacy of the consumers?

The word itself is evocative, rich: elixir.

The medicine itself is even more so!

Bees love herbs, and their love brings us honey; infusing herbs into honey brings us round full circle.

Learn how to make your own delightful and medicinal herbal elixirs using honey, spirits, and herbs. These are delicious and potent remedies with a long history. Honey and alcohol are both excellent menstruums for the medicinal properties of plants, and each extracts a different profile; mixing them together creates a full-bodied, well-rounded medicine.

We’ll teach you all you need to know to make your own elixirs at home, going through all the steps together. We’ll send you home with suggested recipes to try, as well as general ideas about which herbs are best suited to this form, and which maladies respond best to it.

This class will be hands-on, light and lively. No prior experience necessary!

results.description:
Welcome new members!  Please note, RSVPs are required to attend this 35-person, multi-site game night.  The open RSVP spots on Meetup are for new members.

We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing complex board games -- the kind of board games that make you think. We play a variety of games, most of which are Euro style games of medium complexity.  Games often last 90 minutes or more and involve juggling a lot of rules and factors in your head, to decide what to do.  However, there's also plenty of laughter and friendship involved.  If that sounds up your alley, we hope you'll join us. 

Our weekly meetup is in a TERRIFIC space for games steps from the Kendall Square T, with easy parking, and lots of room to spread out in.  Full directions are below.  The building door does get locked in the evening, but there is plenty of foot traffic in and out.

Our meetups happen once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 pm onwards.  Our group has been running since 2007, and we have about 35 attendees each week, including regulars and new members.

1. Due to finite space, you must RSVP to attend.  If you are having a hard time getting a spot, please send a message to the organizer and we will try to work something out!

2. We ask new members for a one-time donation of $5 towards our site fees.  After that, game night is completely free!

3. Please save loud and/or big games (like those with real-time arguing) for when the room is less full -- typically we thin out slightly by 10:00.  This allows us to accommodate more people, and play a greater variety of games.

We play whatever people bring, which typically includes a lot of Euros.  Here's a "tip of the iceberg" look at a few games that have been popular lately:

7 Wonders, Terra Mystica, Race for the Galaxy, Splendor, One Night Werewolf, Le Havre, Hansa Teutonica, Machi Koro, Concordia, Super Big Boggle

As you can see, there is some real variety.  (We do play some light games, but if that's the main thing you want to play, please try our Light Game Night instead!)  Our regular attendees bring about 20-30 games between them, so there's always a lot to choose from.  But if you have a game you like, just bring it with you!

If you haven't played these kind of games before, but think you'll like them, you're welcome too!  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); heavy strategy or negotiation games (like 18xx, wargames, or Diplomacy); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

Finally, a note about Settlers of Catan and Ticket to Ride.  These are traditional "gateway games" that many people play when they first discover Euros.  Although you will occasionally find those games at our meetups, many of us have played them to death and have become more interested in games with a little more complexity to them.

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Cross the street. (If you take the escalator up, turn around first to see the street.) After crossing, proceed behind the T entrance (perpendicular to Main Street).  Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs or elevator straight up. Proceed straight ahead (perpendicular to Main Street). Building E25 is the brick building a quarter block down, across from the parking lot.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it.
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west)
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south.
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.)
3) Take the first right, onto Main St.
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical. Exit the parking lot at the rear (opposite from where you entered). Building E25 will be directly across the street.

Once you enter, Room 119 is just past the stairs on the right.  We ask new members for a one-time donation of $5.00 that goes towards site fees.

Feel free to email with any questions -- we hope to see you at a meetup soon.

results.description:
Our lighter games meetup event.  This is a great opportunity to socialize and play games in a relaxed environment -- and best of all, there's no cap on attendance.

We are a casual group of people who enjoy playing complex board games -- the kind of board games that make you think. We play a variety of games, but the games at this particular event are going to be on the smaller side -- because those are often the games that work best in a cafe setting.

Our main meetup requires RSVPs due to heavy popularity and finite space.  This event runs simultaneously, a few buildings away.  RSVPs are NOT required for this event.  RSVPs are still appreciated so the event hosts know how many people to expect, but you don't need to update them and can come even if you don't RSVP.

This event takes place once a week (alternating Mondays and Wednesdays), from 7:00 - 11:00.  There are two excellent cafes right there, Clover and Bailey & Sage.  Their food is honestly pretty good, so please take advantage of them if you are hungry for dinner, soft drinks, or snacks.

We play whatever people bring, but you don't have to bring anything -- the hosts will always have a bag of games with them!  Some games that you might expect to see here include:

Red 7, Love Letter, Codenames, Pictomania, The Resistance, Avalon, One Night Ultimate Werewolf, Bang!, Glory to Rome, Innovation, Mottainai, Chrononaughts, Time Lines, Tash-Kalar

If you're looking for longer or larger Euros (like 7 Wonders, Puerto Rico, or Terra Mystica), check out our regular "Not as Light Game Night" meetup.

If you haven't played these kind of games before, but think you'll like them, you're welcome too!  But be aware that you are NOT likely to find traditional American games (like Monopoly, Sorry, Risk, or Poker); heavy strategy or negotiation games (like 18xx, wargames, or Diplomacy); or pure abstract games (like Chess).

OUTBOUND (from Boston / from Park Street)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the front of the train. Face the street and walk one building to your right.  The entrance is right in between Clover and the MIT Co-Op.

INBOUND (from Alewife / Porter / Harvard / Central)
Take the Red Line to Kendall Square station. Exit at the gates at the rear of the train. Take the stairs up, then up again towards the busy street, which is Main Street.  Cross the street, turn left and walk past one building.  The entrance is right in between Clover and the MIT Co-Op.

FROM BOSTON (or Memorial Drive) 
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading north (cross the river if coming from Boston).  Memorial Drive is the first cross street past the river; go past it. 
2) Take the first right, onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the first right after Memorial Drive.) 
3) Take the first right, onto Main St. 
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical.
5) Walk back to Main Street.  Cross the street, turn left and walk past one building.  The entrance is right in between Clover and the MIT Co-Op.

FROM CAMBRIDGE (or points west) 
1) Take Massachusetts Ave heading south. 
2) Take a left onto Vassar St.  (Vassar is the last left before Memorial Drive; there is a railroad crossing there.) 
3) Take the first right, onto Main St. 
4) Pass two signals, then turn right onto Hayward.  You may park in the parking lot on the right side of Hayward.  An MIT parking permit is NOT required in the evening, but please do not park in the spaces marked Medical.
5) Walk back to Main Street.  Cross the street, turn left and walk past one building.  The entrance is right in between Clover and the MIT Co-Op.

Come join us every first Wednesday of the month for our friendly and casual social get together where we discuss the latest news and events in the atheist and secular community and strike up various conversations relating to atheism (philosophy, humanism, a/theology, politics, and scientific skepticism). We also like to talk about just about anything else of interest (geek culture, technology, pets, etc.) and chill with like-minded people like yourself.

If you are new to the group, please come in and say hi. If you are nervous, don't be. Many of us had the same feeling the first time and then decided to come a second, third, etc. Feel free to come alone or with a friend or more. Just come. We enjoy having those conversations that you may find difficult to have with your family, friends, or coworkers. You may be surprised what friends you will find here.

See you soon.

results.description:
"Hindsight is 20/20," meaning that it is always clearer, as in perfect 20/20 vision, to see the mistakes we have made by looking in the past (hindsight).

How wonderful it would be if we made less mistakes and gained 20/20 vision without the use of Hindsight.. It is called using your Intuitive Powers.

You may ask; "I am not psychic, therefore, do I have intuitive powers?"

The answer is YES.

Have you ever heard the little voice in your head telling you "Yes" and then you chose "No?"Have you ever had a "Gut" feeling that something just wasn't right, but you did it anyway?

That is your Psyche speaking to you, your Intuitive Power.

There are many ways to tap into our own intuitive powers.
This workshop will:

Define Intuitive Power

Introduce several methods of tapping into your powers

Clarify what methods are the right choice for you.

Please join us.

Ellen Sklaver

Motivational Coach

results.description:
Wednesday night is our (almost) weekly get-together for open gaming at the Panera Bread location in Porter Square. All are welcome to join us, regardless of experience level!


If you have a game you are particularly interested in playing, you are welcome and encouraged to bring it. But this is not required; many people typically bring a selection of their favorites and we're always happy to teach. The only things you need to bring are an open mind and a good attitude. If you're particularly hot to try something out, you are encouraged to leave a comment and see if you can drum up some interest beforehand. Please bear in mind that table space is limited, so an especially huge or epic game may not be appropriate for the venue (but see our Sunday night event at Pandemonium in Central Square for an alternative venue).


The event officially opens at 7 PM, but some people like to show up early; those who show up early should feel free to get started on a shorter warm-up game if time allows.


We look forward to seeing you at the gaming table!


WHERE WE SIT: Unless the restaurant is super-crowded, we gather in the basement dining area; just look for the games and say hi. We're friendly, honest!


GETTING THERE:


The Panera is located within easy walking distance of the Red Line T and several bus lines, and public transit is probably the easiest way of getting there. If you drive, mall parking is (theoretically) limited to 2 hours except where posted. I've never heard of anyone getting towed for overstaying this limit. For the extra-cautious, there are metered spots on Mass Ave; check the meter to be sure but most Cambridge meters don't need to be fed after 6 PM or 7 PM. There is also a Hubway bike-share station less than five minute's walk from the mall.


SOME NOTES:


As a group, we don't usually make a huge deal about attendance policy, however: attendance at these events is limited, and our Panera events are usually not huge; one side effect of this is that RSVPing and then not showing up can have a disruptive effect on our events, and for particularly popular events, "no shows" take up a spot from someone who wanted to be there. Bottom line: If you RSVP for a Panera event, please make a good-faith effort to show up or at least let us know if you can't make it.


As far as possible, please also let us know if you're going to be more than a few minutes late. As a rule of thumb, if we haven't heard from you and you arrive after 7:15 or so, you're likely to be limited to a spot at whatever game has room for an extra player. Much later than that, and we'll almost certainly be underway without you! You're welcome to show up and socialize and of course we'll try to accomodate you if we can, but we can't guarantee you a game. Because we as a group tend to play longer and more involved games, most groups at our events tend to play one and only one game per night.


Panera has been quite gracious about hosting our group with minimal fuss. To ensure that this happy state of affairs continues, please give them some business if you're hungry or thirsty and (especially) respect the hardworking people who work there, and their desire to go home after a long shift -- be ready to leave when the restaurant closes at ten.

results.description:
"A universal theology is impossible, but a universal experience is not only possible but necessary. It is this experience toward which the course is directed." (ACIM Manual for Teachers)

Designed to correct perception and lead to a universal experience of knowledge, A Course In Miracles has been translated into 23 languages, is referenced and utilized by many of today's most reknowned spiritual teachers, and has inspired countless books and curriculums based on its teachings. But it can be a difficult book to grasp. It is lengthy, the writing is abstract, and its use of Christian terminology alienates many.

And yet it has become one of the most influential spiritual books of today. Join us as we dive into it, and are led to understand its principles against the backdrop of our own personal experiences and insights. Beginner as well as advanced Course students are welcome. We'll start with a short meditation, and then use a reading from the Course as an entry point into our time together. Cost $5 per person.

Bringing a copy of the book is helpful, but not necessary. Recommended (but again not necessary) is the combined volume that includes the three supplements (Clarification of Terms; Psychotherapy: Purpose, Process, and Practice; The Song of Prayer), available online from The Foundation For Inner Peace at acim.org.

results.description:
The word itself is evocative, rich: elixir.

The medicine itself is even more so!

Bees love herbs, and their love brings us honey; infusing herbs into honey brings us round full circle.

Learn how to make your own delightful and medicinal herbal elixirs using honey, spirits, and herbs. These are delicious and potent remedies with a long history. Honey and alcohol are both excellent menstruums for the medicinal properties of plants, and each extracts a different profile; mixing them together creates a full-bodied, well-rounded medicine.

We’ll teach you all you need to know to make your own elixirs at home, going through all the steps together. We’ll send you home with suggested recipes to try, as well as general ideas about which herbs are best suited to this form, and which maladies respond best to it.

This class will be hands-on, light and lively. No prior experience necessary!

Wednesday, May 4th, 2016
7:00pm – 9:00pm
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline

The fee for this class is $20.

RSVP by filling out our contact form, emailing us at [masked], or calling[masked]-5274.

results.description:
You are at the edge of the diving board. Do you jump or climb back down?

This life transformation healing is taking the jump from who

you are to who you want to be. Through our intention and the power of 

sound, we come together to stand in our power and resonate with the highest

versions of ourselves.  

As for the healing itself, everyone will lie down on comfy mats in a beautiful temple (bring your own blanket) and enter into a state of deep relaxation as I play my tibetan bowls and gongs and drum. As I go to do healing work with each one of you, everyone else benefits from the shifts that occur in more ways than one.  

I've done many healings before but this one is different.

As of now, I've stepped away from my job in the mundane word to do healing full 

time. When I first picked up a singing bowl over half a year ago, I did not 

know where  it was going to lead. But now I am happy to say it leads toward 

liberation.  I know all of you are on the same path of doing exactly what you want 

with your time. It is completely liberating when you follow your calling because 

your calling comes to you. All you need to do is answer. The universe supports us 

when we follow our bliss. 

I hope you can join me on the 6th ... If you want me to personalize your healing, 

beforehand call me at[masked]-8601. I make no claims for what I do. I merely 

facilitate and hold space for the healing and transformation you need to do 

yourself.  

An energetic contribution for this event keeps the cycle flowing!

Thanks and love,

Brian

results.name: Life Transformation Healing

results.description:
My grandmother was a fashion designer in the 1920's and '30's (I miss her dearly), and taught me many things like by 13 a girl should start learning how to walk in heels and how to wear lipstick so by the time she's a woman they will be genuinely effortless (which to her was an anchor of chic).  She also taught me how to shop for perfume.  One was to never buy perfume on the spot rather one should put one or two on and then test it throughout the day and see how it wears.  I personally have tried a perfume that smelled great an hour later, but after two hours it smelled like toilet bowl cleaner...not kidding...and that smell lasted for hours! It was awful and my husband had to suffer right along with me as perfume is an odd, public toiletry. With that said I warmly invite all Beauty Addicts to join me at (deep breath) Sephora (eeee!!! my candy shop) and test drive two or possibly three, if you wear a short sleeve shirt:), new scents for Spring/ Summer as I genuinely feel one's scent should change with the seasons.  After around 45 minutes (or so), I thought we could then go to dinner, and as we laugh and chat we could periodically check on our trial patches and see if any of the perfumes we tried had evolved into something wonderful.  And remember a perfume should be nothing short of wonderful as it sits directly on your skin and meets others when you hug or kiss them.:)

Note: We will first meet up at Sephora (CambridgeSide Galleria) at 7:00pm then walk over to Cheesecake Factory (CambridgeSide Galleria) for dinner at 8:00.

venue.name: Grow Native Massachusetts at the Cambridge Public Library

results.description:
Presented by Grow Native Massachusetts.

Few wild places remain in today’s world, making it ever more important to bring ecological principles back into the design of our managed landscapes. Much more than simply using native plants, this work necessitates understanding plant communities and embracing a new form of design that marries horticulture with ecology. Join us as we translate the ecological principles of wild plant communities into design and management tools to inform our native plantings. Using the work of several European ecologists and planting designers, we explore the science behind stable and lasting plant combinations—to help you create the landscapes you envision.

Claudia West is the co-author with Thomas Rainer of “Planting in a Post-Wild World”, and the Ecological Sales Manager at North Creek Nurseries. She works closely with ecological design and restoration professionals throughout the northeast, focused on stable, layered planting designs and the extensive use of native plants. Learn more at: http://grownativemass.org/programs/eveningswithexperts
results.name: Planting in a Post-Wild World, a talk by Claudia West

results.description:
Next up is Sky Doll by Alessandro Barbucci and Barbara Canepa. This will be held on a Wednesday, to allow those who can't make Tuesdays a chance to attend a book discussion.

Book is available at Amazon for $30:

http://www.amazon.com/SKY-DOLL-DECADE-Alessandro-Barbucci/dp/1782767363


And since the above is a new edition, here's the first out of print volume, which has more reviews:

http://www.amazon.com/Sky-Doll-Graphic-Novel-Pb/dp/0785142940/

You'll want to buy the hardcover one though, in the first link.

 The Bumf:

In a parallel universe, the existence of a sweet life-like android called Noa, a Sky Doll, is about to be turned upside down. When she is rescued by "missionaries" from her role as servant to a tyrannical master, it becomes clear that she may be more than just a robotic toy after all...


Alessandro Barbucci and Barbara Canepa are the Italian team behind the series W.I.T.C.H and Monsters Allergy. After working for Disney, the pair decided they wanted to create a world that explored the socio-political impact of religion, with more adult content, and so the Sky Doll series was born.


I read this book a few years ago, back when it was out of print, and I remember the art being great and the story was an interesting mix of sci-fi and strange religion in the future.

The venue is the Friendly Toast, which is a very casual kinda place with plenty of room where we can easily be heard. Please note though, that it's best to bring cash - although supposedly their card minimum has been relaxed - perhaps even obliterated!

As always, feel free to post a discussion question below, to be asked during the meet.

The medicine itself is even more so!


Bees love herbs, and their love brings us honey; infusing herbs into honey brings us round full circle.

Learn how to make your own delightful and medicinal herbal elixirs using honey, spirits, and herbs. These are delicious and potent remedies with a long history. Honey and alcohol are both excellent menstruums for the medicinal properties of plants, and each extracts a different profile; mixing them together creates a full-bodied, well-rounded medicine.

We’ll teach you all you need to know to make your own elixirs at home, going through all the steps together. We’ll send you home with suggested recipes to try, as well as general ideas about which herbs are best suited to this form, and which maladies respond best to it.

results.description:
Here are just some of the things you can get out of these meetings:

• Access to thousands of dollars of courses, software, and other resources

• Advice on overcoming a business or marketing obstacle you're facing

• Accountability, so you actually get your work done and turn your dreams into reality

• Ideas and inspiration to help you make something new or improve what you already have

• Meet awesome people who enjoy talking about this stuff as much as you do

Or, you can be a fly on the wall. No pressure at all. Feel free to drop in to just listen and see what internet marketing really looks like from people who are actually doing it (although we will say hello to you and give you the opportunity to introduce yourself, if you'd like).

Meeting Agenda:

7:00pm Join the meeting here:

https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/daviddrayton.com/weeklyautomatedincomemastermindmeeting

Each week, we do two things at our remote meetings, which we hold through Google Hangouts:

1) Part 1: Status check-ups (20-30 minutes): New members introduce themselves, sharing a bit about their goals and what they hope to get out of the group.  Existing members updates the group on the past week's biggest wins, and provide any other updates that stood out to them that week.

Each member may ask a short question or solicit help from the group as a whole before moving onto the next person, though any topics that deserve more than a minute or two of discussion will be moved to the next part of the meeting.

2) Part 2: Focus Groups (60 minutes+): The group splits out into two focus groups: one focused on selling physical products through platforms, and the other focused on producing and marketing online content.  Examples of the former may include people selling products on Amazon, Etsy, Ebay, through their e-commerce stores, etc.  Examples of the latter would include podcasters, bloggers, affiliate marketers, etc.

This second portion of the meeting may last for as long as the members within that focus group would like to extend the conversation, and members may hop on and off of either conversation at any time.

If you are in the physical product group, you can stay put in your current Google Hangout.  If you're in the online content marketing group, please join this hangout once Part 2 of the meeting begins:

https://hangouts.google.com/hangouts/_/dq4qhhdefftaq3fmqwij2ipe2ea



Anyone can join. It doesn't matter where you are, how older you are, or even what stage of your business you're in. Our regular members include everyone from total beginners who are just getting their feet wet all the way up to serial entrepreneurs who are already making six-figures or more in their spare time doing this stuff.
results.how_to_find_us: Google Hangouts.  JOIN BY CLICKING THE LINK IN THE MEETING DESCRIPTION BELOW.  Give it a shot before the meeting to make sure you can join without any problems.  Let me know if you're having trouble.
