results.description:
• Ready to take this practice to the next level?  

• Spiritually, sensually, intimately?  

• Looking to spend more time going deeper with each partner you encounter?

•   Want to learn more about Tantra and take it into your life in a  more profound way so it impacts your life and not just "in workshop?"  

• Are you willing to stop saying "in my real life...." and come to experience complete integration of body/mind, self and One, spirituality and sexuality?  

__________________________________________

The Intimate Puja Circle - Advanced Practice - will offer an opportunity to go deeper into the practice and with your community, if you choose to.  The first half of the evening will be shorter as well, leaving more room for connection during the Puja Circles in the second half of the night!  

Ever wish you had more time???  You asked for it and here it is!  :)  Please keep reading for more important details..... 

______________________________

This Intimate Puja Circle is for those who have been practicing with me for 3 months or longer.  This is event is for intermediate and advanced practitioners and students. 

_______________________________


If you have not worked with me (Robyn) before but have done other workshops on Tantra, relationship and intimacy - there is a short phone interview required so that we can assess whether the Advanced Practice Intimate Puja Circle is best for you.  Please email me privately [masked] so that we can set up a time to talk.  

_______________________________

Even if you've been before, please read the description below in full before RSVPing to this event.   Thank you!   

_______________________________

Please note that this event runs for 3 hours and will be offered on Friday and/or Saturday nights depending on the month 


_______________________________

A Puja, in Sanskrit, means reverence, honor, worship and adoration.  It's used by the Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, and others -- as a ceremony to honor a very special occasion; it's also used more often as part of a sacred ritual - a practice to support opening to the wisdom of the Divine -- your Source. 

Intimate Puja Circle - Advanced Practice, will be a place to: 

• Share a deeper and sacred connection with the Intimate Puja community

• Learn and practice Tantra, yoga, meditation and other tools and techniques for expansion, awakening and living a joyful, peaceful, abundant life 

• Practice authentic relating with one another; take risks, make choices, honor your boundaries 

• Experience deep connections with those interested in sacred sexuality, energy, expanded orgasm, conscious relationship, spirituality  - people like YOU!

Tantra For Everyone:  

This special evening will begin with many invitations to connect with each other in light and playful ways -- always with the opportunity to go as deep as you choose.  Single or coupled, you'll experience Tantra as a way to say 'hello', get to know one another, mingle and connect.

The Advanced Practice Intimate Puja Circle will offer an opportunity to go deeper if you choose to.  And the first half of the evening will be shorter, leaving more room for connection during the Puja Circles in the second half of the night!  

Here's what Participants are saying!

"This is a very special event; a non-threatening, yet deep and authentic way to meet others. I've been online dating for years and it's just not for me.  I've met some really special people at your events."

"Saved my marriage, literally."  

"Congratulations and thank you for a wonderful evening.  Reflecting on it today, I am just amazed at the intimacy I experienced with virtually no history and the joy I received."

"Very different from my normal way of life, you did create on a small scale  and it was exactly what I was hoping for....the experience of deeper intimacy."

"It's so amazing to walk into a room of "strangers" and walk out feeling in love with everyone!"

"I didn't think I'd be able to connect with anyone there.  I was so surprised, and delighted, how easy it was to enjoy myself with every man in that room! Thank you Robyn, for your excellent facilitation skills. I felt totally safe!"

"We have to wait a whole month until the next one????"

"We love to come as a couple and meet others on a similar path."


The Intimate Puja Circle</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=SHVW639WM28LC"><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=ZES8HVDSP97PA"></a> itself will begin part-way through the night during which you'll have the chance to connect more deeply with others (one-on-one) -- this part of the evening will be facilitated, with a structure offered, however, you will have ample time to co-create with the beloved in front of you!!  You will be at choice and encouraged to ask for 100% of what you want.


Deepen With Your Community:

Once the formal part of the evening is over, there'll be time to dance, hang out, cuddle, snuggle, relax, process, and rest.  There will always be chocolate! 

The Intimate Puja Circle community is growing and growing!  There are hundreds of men, women and couples who have been participating for the past 2 1/2 years.  About 50 - 75% of the monthly gatherings are "regulars" -- spiritual-minded beings who are committed to coming back to love with themselves, God and each other. People's whose lives have changed significantly because of this practice.  

"I have been on a wonderful journey of “Coming back to Love” of self, my children and those that come in my path each day. “Coming back to Mitchell” is synonymous with where I am and how much grateful I am for allowing myself the ability to re-open my heart and soul to those that wish to receive my Shiva and Shakti within me. Instrumental in my shift comes from meeting and integrating the practices of Robyn Vogel, psychotherapist, Intimacy and Sex Coach, and facilitator of “middle-path” Tantra, teaching me Tantra and how being present allows the miracle of conscious living." 

 -- Mitchell Rosenwald / Realtor


Questions You May Have:

Please email me to set up a time to talk if you are unsure whether this Advanced Practice Intimate Puja is for you or not.  [masked]
results.name: SOLD OUT Intimate Puja Circle -  Advanced Practice

This “Major Emotion Picture” introduces us to a young girl’s anger, sadness, disgust, fear, and joy as they disagree on how to help her deal with the traumatic change caused when she is uprooted from her Midwestern lifestyle and moved to a busy and chaotic coastal city. The inner battle she experiences causes problems up in the central living and working place for the five emotions.

Certified FRESH (98%) Rotten Tomatoes critics agree it is inventive, gorgeously animated, and powerfully moving. A psychology lesson for both children and adults, bring a friend, a date, or your whole family for a night of fun-filled entertainment.

About this Group: We meet monthly to look at popular films through the lens of spirituality/faith. All are welcome to join the screening of a recent film followed by a discussion led by a local theologian. BYOBeer, Wine and Soda. Screening and Discussion led by Rev. Anastasia Kidd and/or Rev. Chad Kidd; A Free Will Offering will be collected; suggested donation of 10.00 per person.

6:30 pm doors open; 6:45 Screening; 8:45 - 9:30 Discussion

We provide High Definition films on a large screen, comfortable seating, light snacks and a great discussion leader!

Call[masked] or email [masked] to find out the film title and to get on our mailing list for details about our monthly Faith and Film events as well as our other Arts and Inspiration programs (music, art gallery, and the spoken word).

Please Note: Our film licensing agreement does not allow us to publicly market the name of the film.

Also: see the events page at sanctuaryucc.org

<a href="http://sanctuaryucc.org/events-board/"></a>

results.description:
Kangoo Jumps is one of the latest fitness crazes catching on across the country.  It's an amazing workout for people who are interested in losing weight and building strength. Great for those who want a high intensity cardio workout with far less impact to their joints. Kangoo jumps can burn up to 50% more calories than traditional workouts.

                                                    Meetup Details:


Organizer/Event Host:
Jenna  (SHC)

Kangoo Jumps Instructor:
Wendel C.

Sponsored by:
Kangoo Jumps Club - MA.


Choreography Level:
Easy, basic steps, entry level

Cardio Level:
High Intensity Workout

Location:
Abington

Cost:
$15.00 with Kangoo rental - $10.00 without rental, * Special rate pricing avail to SSH&B/SHC members only.


Attendance Limit:
10 members, limit may increase as needed later.

Gear/Clothing:
Bring 2 pairs of thick socks, similar to those you would wear hiking (wool or wicking). Wear supportive clothing, a good sports bra & bring water. 

Kangoo Rental Sizes:

Small - Womens 4-6 or Mens 3-5
Medium - Womens 6-9 Mens 6-8
Large - Womens 10-12 Mens 9-11
XLarge - Womens 12+, Mens 12-15

Action Required After RSVP:
Please add your Kangoo size to the comments board so that I can arrange to have them onsite for the class.


Communications:
I'll arrive on site early and will use the meetup board to communicate. I'll send my contact info to those that RSVP. Please use text when contacting me if poss.


Misc but Important:
- What happens in Kangoo club stays in Kangoo club - pls don't video tape anyone the without their consent, pics are fine

- There is no secure place to put your things, open lockers are right by the front door so leave your valuables in car or at home.

- Bring cash/exact change (if possible) to expedite 

- Bring a healthy snack with you for the ride home.

- Zumba class lets out prior to the Kangoo classes, there may not be much room to in the foyer to wait around for Zuma to end. I like to wait until the Zuma class exits the building before entering.

- You can not just show up at this event without an RSVP. Kangoos are brought to the location based on your RSVP & size + class size must be controlled due to type of activity. 

Prereqs:
Anyone with basic concepts of aerobics, step, boxing or zumba/dance and enjoys a high intensity cardio workout.

Future Kangoo Jump Events:
Kangoo jump weekend hikes will be posted to meetup under Southeastern Hiking Club (SHC) starting in May. 

Disclaimer:
During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. Meetup hosts, organizers, assistant organizers, leaders, guides and sponsors are not responsible for the safety of participants. By joining the group, you acknowledge and agree to this statement.
results.name: Kangoo Jumps Workout

results.description:
Truth is a process of convergence. The universe has a way stripping off the extraneous qualities of belief in a very pragmatic fashion. In the end, what works or best explains the nature of things is what prevails. The classic mind-body dualism v. monism debate is a classic example. It appears to me to be very likely that the ultimate resolution of the debate is going to be one in which the monists and dualists each proclaim victory. Because in the end—I think, the nature of the mind will be understood in scientific terms that previous scientific explanations deemed impossible or—indeed—dualistic. "Impossible," because the monism of mind-body science will be based upon an understanding of physical reality that permits an utterly dualistic appearance that could even encompass elements of parapsychology and non-locality (a term from quantum physics) in which the dualistic appearances are supported by a monistic substratum. So, indeed, both the monists and dualisits could then—arguably—be right. It might be a nice debate to argue which side is more right. But, really, the convergence of both sides will have made the argument largely moot.

This discussion could appeal to both the Futurology and Mysticism study groups, and many others. I will attempt to develop some discussion points in which mysticism (and related paranormal topics), and the edges of theoretical science and technology may perhaps be converging. As I develop these points, I will update this introduction or post in the comment section at the bottom of the page.

****************************************  ADMISSION FEE:

Bronze and Gold Members are admitted free.


If you are not  a Bronze or Gold Member (paid members), there are two ways by which you may attend:


1) Become a Bronze Member ($15 per year): you will find the payment link on the Membership Page.

2) Message Arthur (Organizer) by clicking the message link on his PROFILE. This applies both for cases in which you are not a paid member but want to attend, or if you are a Bronze or Gold member but would like to bring a guest. Payment  of admission for a single meeting can be arranged.

ADDENDUM:


I POSTED SOME TALKING POINTS ON 4/23 ON THE DISCUSSIONS BOARD, AND i AM POSTING THEM HERE AS WELL:

I am sure that there are many other convergences, but here are three themes that, in my view, tie Mysticism and Singularitarianism.

Here are some convergences between Mysticism and ideas embraced by Singularitarians:

•  Ineffability. It is often joked—sometimes good-naturedly and sometimes sarcastically—that mystics can be very verbose, writing lengthy books about what indescribable. Wittgenstein said that “What cannot be spoken about must be consigned to silence.” Is the post-singularity world a world that is claimed to beyond comprehension because machine intelligence will have taken over from human intelligence: an ineffable world that has similarities to mysticism?

•  Everlasting life. Various spiritual traditions in different forms posit everlasting life after death. Ray Kurzweil argues that life can evade death indefinitely if not permanently. The dream (or some might contend, the nightmare) of everlasting life is a common thread that links mystics and singularitarians.

• Faith. Faith in God (whatever that concept means to you) is a deep belief in a underlying intelligence that in terms of protection or redemption is something that we mere humans can depend upon and that, in some terms, justifies the very process of living. Singularitians have a faith in the ultimate superiority of machines over humans and their flaws, frailties and self-destructive nature. If we can't save ourselves, then our supercomputers and advancing technology will. Faith in God. Faith in machines. Not very Nietzschean, I must say. What about faith in ourselves?
results.name: Are Post-singularity Scientific Visions the New Mysticism?

results.description:
Do you have favorite segments or clips of Abraham’s workshops? Sections of their recordings you listen to more than once? Ones that really resonate for you? Ever finish listening to a piece and wish there was someone right there to talk about it with - to milk that high vibration?

I listen to short clips from the workshop recordings on YouTube almost every day. It’s my morning boost of alignment. Sometimes a really powerful or clarifying piece hits me. I find myself wanting to connect and share.

So I was thinking, I’d love to gather folks together for that - listening to a short (10 or 15 minute ) clip from one of the workshops on a specific topic or concept, and then enjoying some great conversation, discussion, and sharing about it.

Feels like a good way to start your weekend off on a high flying disk - join us on Friday night, May 6th. 

We’ll hang out, listen to some Abe, get to know each other, talk about and how we’re enjoying and applying these teachings in our lives. I’ll have some light snacks to share.

Here’s one of the clips we could start with: https://youtu.be/sEDWY4dE2-Y

And if you have other short ones that you recommend for an evening like this, let me know.

results.description:
This evening our focus will be on using meditation simply to feel good. Mmmm. Who couldn't use some of that?

My intention is to help you deeply relax and let go of your tension and stress, and to leave feeling soaked up with love, appreciation, and good thoughts.

Join us! And let me guide you through three transformative, relaxing, feeling-good meditations.

We’ll deeply relax. We’ll remember happy times. We’ll appreciate. And, we'll dream and create.

Sound good? If so, join us, and invite your friends and family to join us, too!

“Ann was wonderful! I came into the room after the rush of the day and was immediately at peace. Her calm, focused and patient nature was so welcoming. I am still using the techniques taught at this gathering. I'm very grateful to Ann for sharing her time and knowledge.” Linda M.

Treat yourself to this wonderful event for you.

To encourage and support your practice and our community, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment. You can also choose to pay for one class at a time for $20. These fees help to cover all of my costs and the significant time I put into running and preparing for all of the events and the meetup itself. Thank you!

Please RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner. Feel free to invite family and friends, too!

Here's the basic description and format for all of our meditation sessions, with a more specific focus/theme each time we meet, as well. Of course, you do not have to commit to attending every time, however, the more you attend, the more you will benefit; and the better we'll get to know each other!

Guided Meditations for Experiencing Greater Inner Peace, Love, Ease and JOY!

Are you aware of the many benefits of meditating, but can’t get yourself to do it, or it’s too difficult to do on your own?

Do you enjoy the collective energy and ease of guided group meditations?

Meditation can be one of the easiest and most effective means to living with greater harmony, happiness and well-being. It’s also an opportunity to peacefully transform your problems, your fears, and any pain and stress in your life into something more positive.

I also consider meditating one of the most direct and easiest ways to connect to your greater Spirit-Self, and to access all that it has to offer you.

By participating in these group guided meditations, you’ll experience how simple,delightful and easy it can be. You’ll learn and practice:

• Simple yet profound techniques you can easily do for yourself for any length of time that is comfortable for you.

• How to easily get into a meditative state to deeply relax and to create positive, pleasurable feelings, including inner peace, love, ease and joy; and how to bring that into your daily living.

• Techniques to help you shift your perspective and experience of issues in your life causing you stress in some form, and to shift to a more positive perspective, instead.

• How to connect to your inner resources and your best self, to solution consciousness, and how to activate your body's natural healing response.

We have a different theme each time we meet to help build and reinforce positive thinking patterns, beliefs and inner narratives that will support you in living with greater inner peace, love, ease and joy.

We typically have 2-3 guided meditations, with discussion and instruction in between to help you carry the positive feelings and lessons experienced into your day and life.

This is a perfect time to let go of stress and "busy-ness", and to fully let go and relax into bliss. Come with whatever intentions suit you, and the evening is still sure to satisfy. It always works out magically that way.

You're encouraged to bring a journal or notebook and pen to class.

To encourage and support your practice, if you pay for 4 sessions, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check), to be used within 4 months of your payment. Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20. Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.

“I'm leaving refreshed, optimistic, empowered, full of love, and excited about bringing more spirit into everything I do. I’m sure that practicing the techniques I learned tonight will help me very much. Thank you!!! "

"Great meditations! I had a marvelous experience with each of them and a lot to take with me: powerful imagery, good feelings, and new techniques for connecting myself with the Universe. Loved the “love ripple”!”

"I truly value our time together. I tried two other guided meditation classes with other instructors, and I enjoy your classes the most. Why? Because you give us time to reflect, journal and share. It really helps to deepen my experience and expand my perspective. And honestly, I relate more to your meditations and love the sound of your voice. Your guided meditations are like group therapy for the soul."

Class leader (and meetup organizer): Ann Ide, M.A., has been leading guided meditation classes for years, and is also a certified master practitioner in Neuro-linguistic Programming and Hypnotherapy, and certified NLP Life Coach. Ann coaches people to move beyond their personal struggles, to new levels of harmony, happiness and success. With her expert questioning, inner exploration processes and personal change interventions, clients become able to more easily create the happiness they desire.

results.description:
Each and every Friday, we're proud to open the doors of our music school in Central Square for a FREE seminar, demo or meet-up. Hell, we’ll even throw a classical music concert or two. What's in store this week? Let's find out:

Everything that happens once the signal leaves your mixer, how it affects your sound, and what you can do to sound your best in any situation, from the largest venues to the smallest basements.

Baltimoroder was born out of necessity. The story begins in Illinois, where Baltimoroder (aka Erik Pearson) abused cheap Yamaha keytars and Fisher-Price turntables. In high school, punk shows, record stores and raw performance spaces filled his time. On to college, Los Angeles and the mighty KXLU radio station, where he absorbed avant-garde sounds, ambient music and experimental artists. The turning point came after a cross-country trek to Boston and a low-key house party. He took the decks, mixing tracks he had never heard into a swell that kick-started a dance floor. From that night on, the floor never stopped growing. DJing to dance fiends night after night is his passion—whether thugged-out Baltimore music or the retro-sexual glam of Giorgio Moroder. Behold Baltimoroder.

Tickets & RSVP:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/getting-the-best-sound-tips-tricks-for-gigging-djs-56-free-tickets-25140093697

results.description:
Join us for an evening of fun and connection as we play 3 communication games where we get the opportunity to say the truth and be real with each other (no touching and no one takes off any clothes). It's a great start to your evening!


Imagine meeting new people in an environment where everyone feels comfortable to be themselves. It’s a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation—a place where everyone gets to say the truth and feel heard. Through other people putting quality attention on you, and asking you questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening—really listening—to your responses, you have the opportunity to examine yourself. It’s a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good, which allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

You can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you. You don't have to do anything you don't want to, or answer any questions you don't want to answer. The games are designed to create the sensations in your body that you might have during Orgasmic Meditation* without having to actually do the practice—just through talking. What comes up might surprise you.

Even in a room full of strangers, it's amazing how connected we can end up feeling when we are willing to be authentic. It's like a giant exhale when the rest of the world is asking you to hold it in. In just an hour, you may even forget that you are in Boston. 

*At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation, which class or private training you can take with our masterful teachers and coaches, and what we have to offer so you can have more connection, authenticity, and play in your life!

$10, payable at the door.

Please arrive on time—we lock the door promptly at 7:40!

Limited non-resident parking is available alongside our building on Dudley Street, or plentiful metered spaces on Mass Ave are only one block away (and free after 6pm). 

Park at Alewife station for $7. and it's a ten minute walk to the center.

Nicole Daedone (founder of Orgasmic Meditation) on the science of OM:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qg59pToG-Bk&ebc=ANyPxKq5gRnQf_jjWM_RZoCU4BnjyJ3-SMZpf8urZ5SRhyRtOo2yq3hh0SJoMjckytt2C0TE0DkhdufRilud2cfOT8_DxjM_2g

Kirtan Dance Jam  Friday, May 6th from 8-midnight. Tom and Shakti, along with the band Santosha!Let’s sing and dance!

Kirtan is a musical meditation. It’s chanting, and sung call and response. It’s normally very easy to learn because it’s repetitive. It’s in Sanskrit and English. The music makes you want to move!

Dancers of all ages and abilities are invited to dance barefoot, any way you like, with or without a partner, in a smoke and alcohol free environment. Children are welcome.

results.description:
Boston Frisbee is celebrating nine glorious years of existence! In addition to the regular fun, safe, all-inclusive games of frisbee you have come to expect there will be SNACKS AND SUPERMEGAAWESOMEFUN SIDE GAMES AND CONTESTS THAT MAY OR MANY NOT INCLUDE POOL NOODLES!!! Do you like cheeseballs? Cake?!?!?! Capri Sun?!?!?!?!?!?!? Trick question. Of course you do. Come celebrate! Win eternal glory!! (Just kidding, we don't keep score. Everyone wins eternal glory.)

Back by popular demand, the silliest point contest is on! Start brainstorming your silly point now in your quest to win such coveted prizes as a trophy depicting an ultimate frisbee player kicking a ball! Huck the Magic Dragon may even make an appearance!

Whether you've been coming for years or just the past few weeks we'd love to see you there! Keep an eye on the Meetup page as our start time is subject to change depending on youth sports schedule.

8:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

8:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

8:20 - Play!!!!!!

Mysterious times in between: SECRET GAMES AND CONTESTS!!

10:30 - Conclude the meetup and begin socializing.

Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white and a dark-colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a light or dark "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!

results.description:
Here's another source of great info so I added these here and I'll add the rest in other posts...

January 3, 4 - Quadrantids Meteor Shower. The Quadrantids is an above average shower, with up to 40 meteors per hour at its peak. It is thought to be produced by dust grains left behind by an extinct comet known as 2003 EH1, which was discovered in 2003. The shower runs annually from January 1-5. It peaks this year on the night of the 3rd and morning of the 4th. The second quarter moon will block out all but the brightest meteors this year, but it could still be a good show if you are patient. Best viewing will be from a dark location after midnight. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Bootes, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

April 22, 23 - Lyrids Meteor Shower. The Lyrids is an average shower, usually producing about 20 meteors per hour at its peak. It is produced by dust particles left behind by comet C/1861 G1 Thatcher, which was discovered in 1861. The shower runs annually from April 16-25. It peaks this year on the night of the night of the 22nd and morning of the 23rd. These meteors can sometimes produce bright dust trails that last for several seconds. Unfortunately this year the glare from the full moon will block out all but the brightest meteors. If you are patient, you should still be able to catch a few good ones. Best viewing will be from a dark location after midnight. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Lyra, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

May 6, 7 - Eta Aquarids Meteor Shower. The Eta Aquarids is an above average shower, capable of producing up to 60 meteors per hour at its peak. Most of the activity is seen in the Southern Hemisphere. In the Northern Hemisphere, the rate can reach about 30 meteors per hour. It is produced by dust particles left behind by comet Halley, which has known and observed since ancient times. The shower runs annually from April 19 to May 28. It peaks this year on the night of May 6 and the morning of the May 7. The new moon will ensure dark skies this year for what could be an excellent show. Best viewing will be from a dark location after midnight. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Aquarius, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

July 28, 29 - Delta Aquarids Meteor Shower. The Delta Aquarids is an average shower that can produce up to 20 meteors per hour at its peak. It is produced by debris left behind by comets Marsden and Kracht. The shower runs annually from July 12 to August 23. It peaks this year on the night of July 28 and morning of July 29. The second quarter moon will block most of the fainter meteors this year but if you are patient you should still be able to catch quite a few good ones. Best viewing will be from a dark location after midnight. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Aquarius, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

August 12, 13 - Perseids Meteor Shower. The Perseids is one of the best meteor showers to observe, producing up to 60 meteors per hour at its peak. It is produced by comet Swift-Tuttle, which was discovered in 1862. The Perseids are famous for producing a large number of bright meteors. The shower runs annually from July 17 to August 24. It peaks this year on the night of August 12 and the morning of August 13. The waxing gibbous moon will set shortly after midnight, leaving fairly dark skies for should be an excellent early morning show. Best viewing will be from a dark location after midnight. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Perseus, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

October 7 - Draconids Meteor Shower. The Draconids is a minor meteor shower producing only about 10 meteors per hour. It is produced by dust grains left behind by comet 21P Giacobini-Zinner, which was first discovered in 1900. The Draconids is an unusual shower in that the best viewing is in the early evening instead of early morning like most other showers. The shower runs annually from October 6-10 and peaks this year on the the night of the 7th. The first quarter moon will block the fainter meteors in the early evening. It will set shortly after midnight leaving darker skies for observing any lingering stragglers. Best viewing will be in the early evening from a dark location far away from city lights. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Draco, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

October 21, 22 - Orionids Meteor Shower. The Orionids is an average shower producing up to 20 meteors per hour at its peak. It is produced by dust grains left behind by comet Halley, which has been known and observed since ancient times. The shower runs annually from October 2 to November 7. It peaks this year on the night of October 21 and the morning of October 22. The second quarter moon will block some of the fainter meteors this year, but the Orionids tend to be fairly bright so it could still be a good show. Best viewing will be from a dark location after midnight. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Orion, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

November 4, 5 - Taurids Meteor Shower. The Taurids is a long-running minor meteor shower producing only about 5-10 meteors per hour. It is unusual in that it consists of two separate streams. The first is produced by dust grains left behind by Asteroid 2004 TG10. The second stream is produced by debris left behind by Comet 2P Encke. The shower runs annually from September 7 to December 10. It peaks this year on the the night of November 4. The first quarter moon will set just after midnight leaving dark skies for viewing. Best viewing will be just after midnight from a dark location far away from city lights. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Taurus, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

November 17, 18 - Leonids Meteor Shower. The Leonids is an average shower, producing up to 15 meteors per hour at its peak. This shower is unique in that it has a cyclonic peak about every 33 years where hundreds of meteors per hour can be seen. That last of these occurred in 2001. The Leonids is produced by dust grains left behind by comet Tempel-Tuttle, which was discovered in 1865. The shower runs annually from November 6-30. It peaks this year on the night of the 17th and morning of the 18th. The waning gibbous moon will block many of the fainter meteors this year, but if you are patient you should be able to catch quite a few good ones. Best viewing will be from a dark location after midnight. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Leo, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

December 13, 14 - Geminids Meteor Shower. The Geminids is the king of the meteor showers. It is considered by many to be the best shower in the heavens, producing up to 120 multicolored meteors per hour at its peak. It is produced by debris left behind by an asteroid known as 3200 Phaethon, which was discovered in 1982. The shower runs annually from December 7-17. It peaks this year on the night of the 13th and morning of the 14th. The nearly full moon will block out many of the fainter meteors this year, but the Geminids are so bright and numerous that it could still be a good show. Best viewing will be from a dark location after midnight. Meteors will radiate from the constellation Gemini, but can appear anywhere in the sky.

Source(s):
http://www.seasky.org/astronomy/astronomy-calendar-2016.html
results.name: Next Meteor Shower

results.description:
Let's enjoy the serenity, beautiful plantings, and birds that visit this special place. Mt. Auburn Cemetery has been designated an Important Bird Area by the Massachusetts Audubon Society. It is a favorite bird watching destination for members of the birding community, especially well-known as a place to spot spring migrants.

Mount Auburn Cemetery is located on the Cambridge/Watertown line at 580 Mount Auburn Street, just off Storrow Drive. Drive into the Cemetery and park on any road without a green line.

We'll plan to walk the various roads slowly and explore this beautiful place for about 4 hours.

No dogs are allowed. Also, no food is allowed on the grounds. There are some nice restaurants within walking distance.

For more information about the Cemetery, visit their web site: http://www.mountauburn.org/
results.how_to_find_us: Let's plan to meet at the Visitor's Center, near the main gate. I'll send an email with my cell phone number the day before.
results.name: Spring Birding at Mt. Auburn Cemetery

results.description: May 7th is free fishing day for the state of Connecticut. You don't need a fishing license on this day, but all other laws apply so if you are interested you should take a peek at the states website as it gets updated. Folks from another meet up group as well as some people from my work may join us on this trip as it has also been offered to them. We meet at the West Thompson Lake boat launch and be ready to paddle by 8 am. We paddle north up the lake and enter the river mouth. Since we will be working against the spring current it makes sense to go upstream until the arms start to fade or if the boats begin to bottom out, whichever comes first, then fish your distance back down the river, working sections. The river usually yields a few browns and rainbows if all the stars align and you work hard. Must be wearing a PFD and a have a whistle and a light accessible at all times. The rangers have a station on this Lake so I just abide and they leave me alone. Other things that make sense, a net, Dr Slick or needle nose pliers, brimmed hat, polarized eyeglasses, food + water. Light spinning gear works, feel free to use a flyrod. If its a total downpour I will have to cancel, light rain though, can make for a good day. This trip can be a lot of exercise if we have to deal with wind and chop on the lake and the river currents so keep that in mind. Email me if you have any questions.
results.name: Kayak fish the Quinebaug River for trout

results.description:
Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ (978)[masked]


=====

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all of the questions that are part of the process. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event.

Answers DO NOT carry over from one event to another so you must answer them for EACH EVENT. Also, questions might not show up if you RSVP from a phone or tablet so if you don't see them you will need to use a computer.

If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself and others at risk. Consider this before you RSVP.

=== What We're Doing ===

The plan is to hike to one of the 4,000 footers in New Hampshire - Isolation. We will use Glen Boulder Trail, Davis Path, and Isolation Spur Trail to get to the summit. We will then retrace our steps to get back to the trailhead.

If you are interested in participating in this event sign up for the waiting list. I will add people that (1) answer all of the questions that are part of the RSVP process and (2) have done similar hikes within the past three months.

RSVPs close 24 hours before the event.

The maximum group size for this trip will be 10 people because we will be traveling within a Wilderness Protection Area.

Guests aren't permitted.

Dogs are only permitted with prior approval of the event organizer.

=== Trip Summary ===

We start as a group, hike as a group, and finish as a group. Our pace will be that of the slowest hiker. This trip isn't for you if you are faster than the group and don't want to stay with us, if you want to head off on your own, or if you are slower than the group and expect us to constantly wait for you.

On this moderate pace (~2.0 MPH) trip we will hike about 12.1 miles and climb about 5,300 feet. It should take an average hiker about 8 hours 45 minutes to complete (this doesn't include time taking breaks). This event is considered ADVANCED because of the pace, distance, and elevation gain.

Use this link for more information about where we are going and how we will get there:

• http://trailsnh.com/peaks/nh/4000/47-Mt-Isolation-4004

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel this event - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants.


Use this link for the current weather forecast:

• http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=44.2148&lon=-71.3092#.VwxnyNT3aK0

=== What to Bring ===


We might still need traction - either Kahtoola Microspikes or Hillsound Trail Crampons.

Use this link for a list of items needed for a three season day hike: 

• http://files.meetup.com/492954/Three_Season_Dayhike_gear_list.pdf

Do not rely on others to have extra items to share with you at the meeting spot or on the trail. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip. 

=== Directions ===

We will meet at Glen Boulder Trailhead which is located on the west side of Route 16 about a mile south of the AMC's Pinkham Notch Visitor Center. According to Google Maps this spot is about 159 miles from Boston and it will take about 2 hours 56 minutes to drive there.

While carpooling is encouraged you are responsible for coordinating your own rides. Use the comments section below to communicate with others who may also be looking to share a ride.

=== Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer ===

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
results.how_to_find_us: Gray Toyota Highlander or Maroon Honda Accord.
results.name: NH4K ... Isolation (ADVANCED)

Join us for our weekly weekend run! We'll be meeting in Back Bay and logging some miles around Boston. All paces and runner levels are welcome! 

For this week only we’ll be meeting at the Tracksmith pop-up for our Saturday run to help them close out their month-long residence on Boylston Street. The store will be locked during the run so you can store a bag if you need to. If you have any Whippet or Tracksmith gear please be sure to wear it!


Please post your desired pace and distance when you RSVP.
results.name: Whippets Weekend Run

group.name: Dashing Whippets Running Team - Boston Chapter

results.description:
We will run down Comm Ave in the carriage lane to the Chestnut Hill/BC reservoir, with the option to run around the reservoir before turning around. This is an out and back course so the distance is flexible - you can run however many miles you want!  There are some hills - we will run 3 of the 4 Newton Hills along the Boston Marathon course (if you go at least 8 miles - 4 out and 4 back).

Meet outside at the tables next to Bruegger's and the ATM.  We will leave right at 8:30 AM (especially when it is cold out!).

The pace will vary depending on who shows up.  If there is a wide range of paces, we frequently end up splitting into smaller groups based on pace.  Even if your pace doesn't "match up" with anyone else, meeting up with the group and starting the run with everyone is a great way to get yourself out of bed on those early Saturday mornings!
results.name: Comm Ave long run  8-15+ miles

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE THE CHANGE IN TIME AND LOCATION

This is a private shoe clinic for runners who are planning to complete a half or full marathon and raise funds for TeamAIDAsha in 2016 season. RSVPs are required to attend this clinic. You are not required to buy anything at the clinic, but Marathon sports has generously offered 20% discount for any purchase made during the clinic.

Note: We will not have the organized group run this Saturday. Please do the long run on your own on Friday or Sunday. Recommended mileage: 1 mile longer than your last Saturday long run

Agenda

Short introduction to the new runners on the following topics

• Running shoes & bio-mechanics

• Running apparel

• Running accessories (socks, fuel belts, gu, form roller, body glide,...)

• Q&A

• Personal shoe fitting for those who are buying shoes

PS: TeamAIDAsha like supporting the local running store. They have been doing this clinic for us every year since 2003. We do not receive any other benefits from Marathon Sports. 

Program details:  TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fund-raising program. We train runners for their full or half marathon races and runners raise donations for AID and Asha. Both beginner and experienced runners are welcome. Anyone is welcome to RSVP and join us for the group runs up to four time with no obligations. We request formal registrations after attending four group runs.

If you missed the information session you can get an overview of this training and fund-raising program from here.

Looking for more runners: We are always looking for more runners. If any of your friends, family members or colleagues to give us a try and join this meetup group.


Waiver: Lawyers make us do this :-).  By running with TeamAIDAsha program you are agreeing to our official waiver at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/waiver.html
results.how_to_find_us: Look for a group of runners and volunteers
results.name: Shoe clinic

results.description:
This May the entire city of Waltham is going Steampunk once again!

Steampunk is a genre combining science fiction and Victorian era styles. Think leather, brass, glass, and a modern artist's take on elaborate historic clothing. When done well, it is, to say the least, a feast for the photographer's eye.

Is Waltham on the Coast?
Well, no, but this is in our extended backyard and there will be "a sea" of interesting subject matter available. See what I just did there?

Why Waltham?
Waltham is known as the Watch City, having invented the watch, the industrial revolution, and the Internet. Or at least one of those. With Waltham wondering what to do with all those spare antique gears hanging around, and an industrious Steampunk group looking to have a large-scale festival, the two got together and created this first-ever international steampunk city. There may also have been a revived time machine involved.

What can I expect to see?
You will [hopefully> see the world's best steampunk enthusiasts put together a veritable schmorgasbord of photographic goodies. Stuff along these lines:

Photo 1 | Photo 2 | Photo 3 | Photo 4

Google or Bing the term "steampunk" for more.

Where shall we meet?
Events in the city get rolling at 10AM. Those who are coming from afar and want to gather early should meet at or before 9AM at the Cafe on the Common - easy to grab a cup o' Joe and nosh. [map and directions to Cafe on the Common]

From thereon, you'll want to head to what you fancy. There are plenty of suggestions on the Watch City Steampunk page. See the link at the end of this post.

I suggest lunch at Taqueria Mexico, which is right in the middle of all the action. [map and directions]

Where can I find out more?
Nowhere at the moment, but keep checking this website (www.watchcityfestival.com) in the coming weeks as more information is added.

Rain Date
In case of rain or inclement weather, the festival will be moved ot the following day, Sunday, May 8th.
results.name: Watch City Steampunk Festival

results.description:
Golf season is not too far away. 

Please let me know if you are interested in signing up for the Saturday a.m. mixed league at Middleton Golf Course. 

The league plays from 4/16 through 8/27 and there are contests and prizes each week.


This is a par 3 course so you can practice your short game.  The fee to join is $40 and it covers your handicap fee.  You can play 9 or 18 but have to decide which option when you sign up each week.

This league is flexible!

Tee times are from 7:30 to 10:30 and you are NOT required to play every week.  I will make the tee time the week of play and it is usually around 9-10 am until it gets hot and then 8-9 am.

The website is www.middletongolf.com

There are leagues every day if Saturday does not fit your schedule.
results.how_to_find_us: at the course
results.name: Middleton Saturday morning golf league

Drawing on the energy-filled colors of the Aura-Soma® Equilibrium bottles and New Aeon Tarot deck, we will consider the richness of information available in viewing ourselves through the lens of color. Starting with basic chakra colors, we will expand to the rainbow of the aura, learning about symbolic meanings of color and experiencing color as a gateway to insight.  See what the colors reveal about your unique innate gifts and talents, your inner resources for meeting current challenges, and what lies ahead in relationships, career, personal and spiritual development. During the group, Barb will interpret your cards and provide individualized readings for each person.

Barb has studied and practiced the Aura-Soma® Colour Care system since 1999, and has 20+ years’ experience as a coach in the areas of personal development and well-being, including Life Energy Alignment Process, Dowsing, and Labyrinths.
results.name: Color as a portal to insight

results.description:
Join us for an early season bird-watching hike at Broadmoor Audubon Sanctuary.  We'll hike over open fields, ponds, and along the Charles River at the large and amazing Broadmoor Audubon Sanctuary, which is known for its bird species.

Note:  Like most Audubon Sanctuaries, there is a $4 fee for non-members.  Free if you are a member.

ACTIVITY LEVEL:  Easy

WHAT TO BRING:  Hiking appropriate footwear, weather appropriate clothing, binoculars or camera, insect repellent, water for 2.5 hours

AGES:  8+

Reserve your spot at www.llbean.com/dedham!

Note:  This meetup will always say "full" with only the organizer attending.  To reserve your spot go to www.llbean.com/dedham
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the parking lot, near the trail head
results.name: Birdwatching Hike at Broadmoor Audubon Sanctuary

results.description:
Come paddle at one of our practice sessions with Living Root, your 2015 Boston Dragon Boat Festival Grand Champions! We're a social and friendly co-ed team who enjoy the sport of dragon boat paddling.

Are you new to paddling? No problem! We'll show you everything you need to know to paddle on a dragon boat. This is a great way to meet people, get in shape, and do something fun in the sun.

We meet at the docks behind the Barking Crab (88 Sleeper Street in Boston), a short walk from South Station. We paddle rain or shine, so dress for the weather. Wear comfortable workout clothing and footwear that you don't mind getting wet. Bring a bottle of water, and we'll provide all the paddling equipment you'll need and a place to lock up your belongings. We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice. So come join us! Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked].

Additional Location and Parking information can be found here

Check out our website or find us on Facebook!
results.name: Living Root Dragon Boat Practice Session

results.description:
http://www.tailwaggerzpetcare.com/yahoo_site_admin/assets/docs/2016_Enrollment_Form.69132410.pdf

The Boston Pug Meetup has moved to a new time and a new location at Tail Waggerz on California Street in Newton.  Our group will meet on the FIRST SATURDAY of each month from 9-10:30am.  

What's new?

Location: Tail Waggerz  http://www.tailwaggerzpetcare.com/

When: First Saturday of each month

Time: 9-10:30 am

Capacity: Limited to 25 pugs, PLEASE update your RSVP accordingly so those on the waiting list can attend once a spot open

Documents:  Complete Enrollment Waiver and proof of Rabies, Bordetella & Distemper and email to Alicia @  [masked] one week prior to Meetup so we can have the documents on file.  You will  NOT be able to attend if Tail Waggerz doesn't have your information.

EnrollmentForm: http://www.tailwaggerzpetcare.com/yahoo_site_admin/assets/docs/2016_Enrollment_Form.69132410.pdf

Fee: Tail Waggerz will not be charging PRoNE for these Meetups; suggested donation to Pug Rescue of New England $5

Nail Trimming: We will have a nail trimming signup sheet at the beginning of each Meetup and Tail Waggerz will offer this service in parallel with the Meetup for a $10 fee.   

In honor of our FIRST Meetup Tail Waggerz will offer 20% off store wide to our Meetup attendees on May 7th. (some exclusions may apply)

We are VERY excited for our new time and location and limiting our attendees will make for a more enjoyable and safe experience for our pugs.  PLEASE RSVP for attending PUGS only not humans.  (Example I have 3 pugs attending along with my husband and myself my RSVP # would be 3) If you are unable to attend please change your response so another pug may participate.  If you are unable to attend this meetup but plan on attending future meetups we encourage you to get submit your forms so they are on file.  

Tail Waggerz is a doggie camp-like experience. Lots of running and playing, lots of space, lots of good pals and NO CAGES! They proudly to offer over 10,000 square feet of doggie fun!  They also offer CRATE FREE BOARDING, full service grooming, obedience training (both one on one and group classes), and retail. 

Parking at Forte Park in rear of building.

We look forward to seeing you!!!

Boston Pug Meetup - Pug Rescue of New England

Alicia, Mike, Donna & Nick

results.description:
Saturday, May 7, 2016
9:00 AM

Cafe on the Commons
677 Main St, Waltham, MA (map)

This May the entire city of Waltham is going Steampunk once again!

Steampunk is a genre combining science fiction and Victorian era styles. Think leather, brass, glass, and a modern artist's take on elaborate historic clothing. When done well, it is, to say the least, a feast for the photographer's eye.

Is Waltham on the Coast?
Well, no, but this is in our extended backyard and there will be "a sea" of interesting subject matter available. See what I just did there?

Why Waltham?
Waltham is known as the Watch City, having invented the watch, the industrial revolution, and the Internet. Or at least one of those. With Waltham wondering what to do with all those spare antique gears hanging around, and an industrious Steampunk group looking to have a large-scale festival, the two got together and created this first-ever international steampunk city. There may also have been a revived time machine involved.

What can I expect to see?
You will [hopefully> see the world's best steampunk enthusiasts put together a veritable schmorgasbord of photographic goodies. Stuff along these lines:

Photo 1 | Photo 2 | Photo 3 | Photo 4

Google or Bing the term "steampunk" for more.

Where shall we meet?
Events in the city get rolling at 10AM. Those who are coming from afar and want to gather early should meet at or before 9AM at the Cafe on the Common - easy to grab a cup o' Joe and nosh. [map and directions to Cafe on the Common]

From thereon, you'll want to head to what you fancy. There are plenty of suggestions on the Watch City Steampunk page. See the link at the end of this post.

I suggest lunch at Taqueria Mexico, which is right in the middle of all the action. [map and directions]

Where can I find out more?
Nowhere at the moment, but keep checking this website (www.watchcityfestival.com) in the coming weeks as more information is added.

Rain Date
In case of rain or inclement weather, the festival will be moved ot the following day, Sunday, May 8th.
results.name: steampunk festival

results.description:
Are you curious about programming or thinking about pursuing a career in software engineering? 

Then RSVP on this meet-up page for this 2-hour Intro to Coding class happening in the Boston area at CIC Boston. Learn the basics of programming, do hands-on exercises, and meet new people. All for free!

The class is being taught by MakerSquare, which runs some of the top coding schools in the country.

Class officially starts at 9:30am, but please arrive at CIC Boston by 9:15am to mingle with your fellow classmates and settle in. We will end at 12noon, with the last 30 minutes being an optional Q&A session.

What will I learn during the class?

This beginner ­level class will contain several instructor-guided exercises. The class will cover the following topics:

   1. Overview of programming 

   2. Intro to data & data structures

   3. Basics of functions

We ask that you read the Prerequisites section before the start of class and bring your own laptop (Windows, Mac or Linux) with Google Chrome installed.

What is MakerSquare Boston?

MakerSquare is a three-month full-time school for software engineering. By teaching computer science fundamentals and modern web languages like JavaScript, we prepare students to join top flight engineering teams.

We have campuses all over the country, and are excited to be opening a campus in Boston. The free Intro to Coding class is to introduce more people to the wonderful world of programming and to get the community excited about the launch of our full-time class in Boston in July 2016!

Questions? Email us at [masked].

results.description:
Join us for a Scratch Educator Meetup on Saturday, May 7! The meetup is free and includes lunch.

What's a Scratch Educator Meetup?

Scratch: a free tool for exploring computational creativity by programming interactive media (like stories, games, animations, and simulations) and sharing those creations with others online, used by millions of people all around the world

Scratch Educator: a teacher who wants to support computational creativity in the classroom and beyond, helping learners—from elementary school to high school, across curricular areas and settings—imagine, program, and share with Scratch 

Scratch Educator Meetup: a gathering of Scratch Educators who want to learn with and from each other, sharing their ideas and strategies for supporting computational creativity in all its forms 

What will we be doing at the meetup?

If you're new to the meetup format, here's what they are and how they work. Meetups are informal gatherings for educators who work with (or are interested in working with) Scratch. The meetups are organized into three parts:

1. We start with networking over light refreshments, getting to know fellow attendees and sharing what people want to explore during the meetup.

2. We collaboratively decide how to structure our learning and then form small groups based on our different interests. Maybe you want to have a discussion about classroom strategies or get more practice with Scratch—or something else entirely. Feel free to move between groups if the session that you're in isn't working for you.

3. We gather as a whole group for lunch and group sharing. You might pose a question to discuss with the group, or share something from your classroom. This is a great time to inspire and be inspired.

Want to know more about meetups? Check out this recap of our recent meetup in Washington D.C.!

What should I bring?

Curiosity. And a laptop that supports Flash will be helpful for the hands-on activities. If you're new to Scratch, you can check it out at http://scratch.mit.edu

We look forward to meeting up with you!
results.name: Scratch Educator Meetup: May 2016

results.description:
On around the Fifth of May, groups all across the country gather in order:

-  to affirm a commitment to the Constitutional separation of religion and government; 

- to bear witness to the intrusion of supernaturalist ideology into all spheres of our government; 

- express thanks to those whose labor and sacrifice creates and sustains a society where freedom of belief and freedom of expression are held in the highest regard; 

- to build awareness of reason as an essential civic virtue; and

- to celebrate reason as the guiding principle of our secular democracy; 

Oh: and also to enjoy flapjacks. Taking as our model the long-standing tradition of pancake breakfasts to mark the National Day of Prayer, we invite Boston Atheists and their allies to come on out, dig into some breakfast fare, and show your Reason pride.


Dress to impress, because we're going to taking a photo by the Statehouse with a Day of Reason banner on display, and who knows? Maybe we can get a few legislators to drop by. This is the first year the BA is holding an observance of the National Day of Reason -- hopefully, we can make it an annual pancake-themed tradition.

results.description:
We practice L'Arte D'Armizare (The Art of Bearing Arms), a historical European martial art. Our main sources of interpretation are the books (circa[masked]) of Fiore dei Liberi, a fencing master from Friuli (thus the non-standard Italian spellings!).

Our students work on a combination of longsword, abrazzare (grappling), daga (dagger/knife) and other weapon skills. These skills are drawn from direct translation from historical sources, developed through multiple physical interpretations and tested at speed. Though we emphasize historical technique, our training sessions are a blend of warmup, interpretation, drill, and for men and women who've passed our safety standards, both focused and open sparring.

New students should take our beginners' class first, or contact our instructors for more information.  We're happy to have visiting scholars from other programs come and play!

See you there!

results.description:
The Limitless Mind: an exploration of time, space and buddha nature

Saturday | May 7 |  10am – 1:30pm

What is mind? Is it a product of the world or is the world a product of the mind? Does mind occupy space, or is space created by mind? Does time change the mind, or can mind change time?

These types of questions may have given rise to interesting speculative considerations, but within Buddha's teachings we can find clear and extraordinarily beneficial answers. Through following the practices known as Mahamudra we can learn to experience the nature of our mind directly in meditation. What we discover is a limitless mind, in particular a mind of limitless potential, capable of universal love, profound wisdom, and unceasing joy.

In this course Kadam Morten, Resident teacher of Kadampa Meditation Center- New York City,  will guide us in simple but profound meditations on the mind, through which we can experience its limitless and pure nature for ourselves. This experience will enable us to understand experientially our potential for transformation, and how changing our mind will change our world. We will also discover how it is possible to purify our mind, and consequently change both our past and our future. This course will help us to understand our life as a place of virtually limitless possibilities, and show how we can begin now to create the causes for the life we want, and eventually the enlightened life that is our highest potential. Everyone Welcome!

Cost | $20 Earlybird Special; $30 tickets starting April 23

Tickets available soon.

Session 1:  10 – 11:30am

Break: 11:30am – 12pm

Session 2: 12 – 1:30pm

This half-day retreat is accessible for both beginners and long-time meditators alike.  A great opportunity to explore Buddhist philosophy and learn fundamental skills to establish a meditation practice.

meditationINboston.org

For more info please call[masked] or email [masked]

Run Details: Meet up with The Most Informal Running Club Ever at 10:00am for the weekly Saturday Fun Run. We'll split up into groups depending on the turnout for distance and time goals for 4, 6 or 7 mile loops. It's your choice!

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It's that easy.

Breakfast Details : Between 11:15 and 11:30 (depending on how long we run) we will meet back at Eastern Mountain Sports on Commonwealth Ave. near Packards Corner for Pot Luck style brunch.

Contribute to a great breakfast with an item to share with the group (eggs, bagels, fruits, muffins, juice, bacon, potatoes, etc.) You're not obligated to bring anything, though, so please join us for breakfast after the run anyway.

ALL ABILITY LEVELS WELCOME!!!

Secret parking is accessible in the Star Market parking lot (just make sure you walk through Star Market. No one has ever been towed.)

Bring a friend, see you out there.


informalrunning.com


Read the BLOG
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be eating breakfast.
results.name: The Saturday Big Group Run w/ Pot Luck B-Fast

group.name: Boston Informal Running Club: Home of TMIRCE:BOS

Greetings!

Outdoor Tennis Season is upon us. Woohoo!  And the courts at Newton South are now lighted.

I've been informed that Newton South is playable.  Just don't wear your nicest tennis shoes as there may be a little surface grit.

Other tennis court suggestions are welcome, especially for those who may live in a different West Boston area.

Please RSVP if you're interested. Right now it's open for 4 people for doubles. If there's more interest, we'll open up the meetup and grab two courts.


You're host for this meetup will be Gary.

Thanks!


Chris J.

results.description: Join us for next week's community chorus rehearsal as we work through one of the most beloved of Mozart's choral works, Requiem. If you haven't yet made it to a rehearsal, this is the time to jump in, as we are planning a Living Memorial for the victims of September 11th, on the 15th anniversary this year in September, with our New York Community Choruses. And don't forget the Music Evening scheduled for June 17th. The chorus will be performing, but we also want to invite many people from the public to be in the audience. Stay tuned for details.

results.description:
Interested in comics? Come to the comic book brunch where we will discuss our favorites over some classic brunch options on FREE COMIC BOOK DAY:  http://fivehorsestavern.com/davis-square/brunch . After food, we can stop off at the local comic book store, Comicazi ( http://www.comicazi.com/) to browse and point out the comics we were discussing.

There is no set agenda, but hopefully it will be a little more focused to comics from the overall sci-fi/fantasy genre. If people are interested, we can do this again.

Five Horse Tavern and Comicazi are both in Davis Square, conveniently located on the Red Line. For those who drive, be careful to pay your meters, they do ticket like fiends in Davis Square.
results.name: Comic Book Brunch (with comic store trip) on FREE COMIC BOOK DAY!

results.description:
The Cambridge Tarot & Qabalah Study Group regularly meets on the first Saturday of every month, from 10:30 AM to Noon at the Theosophical Society in Boston located at 21 Maple Street Arlington, MA 02476. Except for an interest in Tarot and Qabalah, no prior knowledge or preparation on your part is required. 

 Our current study uses Paul Foster Case’s The Tarot: A Key to the Wisdom of the Ages. You may review the chapter and the corresponding Tarot Key for the current session or receive an email with a list of our discussion questions, and bring any questions or observations you may have to the group. Materials are provided at each meeting. Come and enjoy the invigorating discussions, reflections and insights.  

This study group is free of charge and open to the public, so invite your friends, and we look forward to meeting with you at our next session. Please note: Currently this group is NOT sponsored by Builders of the Adytum, but is working to meet the requirements of a B.O.T.A. official group. For more information about the work of B.O.T.A., please visit them online at http://www.bota.org.
results.how_to_find_us: Room 2D
results.name: Monthly Cambridge Tarot & Qabalah Study Group Meeting

results.description:
Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary.


• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal here: "Boston 1 - Join us"

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: "Boston 1 e-waiver"


• Make sure to check our Facebook, </a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards.


• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended.


• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 


All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $6 flat rate.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Saturday Water training

results.description:
We'll do a local bike ride into Boston along the Charles River. Once we get to Boston, we will have lunch, walk around, maybe watch performers around Fanueil Hall, head over to the Public Market, etc. Plus, there is a potential free ice cream event at the Boston Commons.

Skill Level:  There will be some biking on Boston streets after we get off the bike trail. Thus you need to be skillful enough to co-exist with cars & pedestrians and know the rules of the road. If you haven't been on a bike for awhile or never rode on the street before, this may not be the best time to start.

Things to Bring:  Helmet, water, snack, money for food, bike lock, spare tube in case you get a flat, etc.  Make sure your brakes are functional and tires have air.


Bike Rental: See comments section.  Our meeting point does not have a rental shop.  There will be future biking events with easier rental options.

results.description:
Hi All,

The weather still doesn't seem to want to be cooperating with us, so let's do one more indoor/outdoor sketching event. Let's sketch the Boston Fire Museum! The station was originally built in 1891 in Boston's trademark Romanesque style. The station's main function was to protect the textile companies in the surrounding buildings. 

Now the museum hosts artifacts of Boston firefighting history including original model and vintage fire engines.

So let's check out some vintage engines and sketch an important piece of Boston's history. Also, I was told there might be a Dalmatian puppy on site. Hope to see you there!

-Miriam
results.how_to_find_us: I will be in the museum with a dark blue messenger bag with green and white flower shapes.
results.name: Let's Sketch! Boston Fire Museum

results.description:
By signing up and/or attending a Boston Area Photography Group meetup you agree to the Boston Area Photography Group Disclaimer below.

No guests are permitted on Boston Area Photography Group events. Please have your guests join our Meetup. 

MEETUP DESCRIPTION:  We had a great Meetup at this event last year so why not do it again? For those new to the Steampunk Festival, here's a link to the event page: http://www.discoverwaltham.us/waltham-calendar/watch-city-steampunk-festival-2016

Public parking less than 2 blocks away (Common & Middle Streets) and the venue is steps away from the Waltham stop on the Fitchburg line.

Excellent opportunity to practice your portrait skills with a large and eager subject population. These people are in their happy place and the vibe is very upbeat.

As always, you can get some great captures with just about any camera/lens you have - it all depends on the wetware behind the viewfinder. 

GEAR/CLOTHING/FOOTWARE SUGGESTIONS:  The only gear suggestion I would make is to think about lighting - speed lights, maybe a softbox and small stand. I saw a woman at last year's event who her brought her own VALS!

Remember: We are volunteers. You are responsible for your own safety and enjoyment.

results.description:
Tickets are available now!

Visit: http://dronedayboston.com for information and tickets

Drones have a bad reputation, and even though many of us call our Multi-rotors by different names, the public does associate our fantastic machines with the word drone.  We are here to make sure that Drones are seen in a positive light.

The purpose of International Drone Day is to show the world that drones are good, and can be used for many good purposes. Movie making, search and rescue, police work, architecture, inspections, emergency response, and for just having fun.

Groups of drone enthusiast get together into organized groups all across the world to fly their drones, and invite friends, neighbors, and the media to showcase drones in a good way
results.how_to_find_us: http://dronedayboston.com
results.name: International Drone Day Boston 2016

results.description:
Based on the untold story of one of the greatest minds of his generation, The Man Who Knew Infinity charts the incredible life of Srinivasa Ramanujan (Dev Patel, Slumdog Millionaire), whose genius for mathematics takes him from the slums of India to Trinity College, Cambridge University in the early 20th-century. Spurred on by his mentor G. H. Hardy (Academy Award winner Jeremy Irons, Reversal of Fortune), Ramanujan overcomes racism and the rigidity of academia to revolutionize the field with his startlingly original theorems, which he attributes to divine inspiration. Driven by the engaging rapport between Patel and Irons as two vastly different men who find common ground in the world of numbers, The Man Who Knew Infinity is a fascinating look at how an unlikely, cross-cultural friendship changed the world.

More info to follow.  

Frank
results.how_to_find_us: After the movie, briefly up near the screen on the right, and then moving quickly to the base of the stairs in the lobby so folks can use the restrooms. Then we'll trek over to Friendly Toast for discussion.
results.name: "The Man Who Knew Infinity", Saturday 11:45am, Kendal

results.description:
Apache Apex (incubating) is a next generation native Hadoop big data platform. This talk will cover details about how it can be used as a powerful and versatile platform for big data.

Title: Introduction to Apache Apex - The next generation native Hadoop platform

Agenda

11:30am:12:00noon - Network, Food, Drinks

11:45am - 1:30pm - Presentation, Q&A

Presenter : Pramod Immaneni Apache Apex (incubating) PPMC member, committer and senior architect at DataTorrent Inc, where he works on Apex and specializes in big data applications. Prior to DataTorrent he was a co-founder and CTO of Leaf Networks LLC, eventually acquired by Netgear Inc, where he built products in core networking space and was granted patents in peer-to-peer VPNs. Prior to that he was a technical co-founder of a mobile startup where he was an architect of a dynamic content rendering engine for mobile devices.

follow @ApacheApex, download, Apache Apex releases, docs
results.name: Introduction to Apache Apex - The next generation native Hadoop platform

group.name: Introduction to Apache Apex-Next generation Hadoop Platform

results.description:
Hi Thinkers,


Thought Articulation (TA) is a more precise way to think about thinking.  It links a heuristic with an algorithm (judge and do) to symbolically represent intelligence.  TA will be taught in this meeting.

If you attend, you will get smarter.  Why?  How?

If you know how your brain/mind works, you may consciously make it work better.  That conscious ability will be taught in this class.  -g

===============


PS:  James, Swan, and I will be presenting how TA was used to create the FirstLearn™.  You may seen that work at www.FirstLearn.org.

PPS:  The presentation slides will be sent out in advance, in the next couple of weeks.

This Meetup is intended for Intermediate + level players or higher, which means:Yankee C and above level, players with firm understanding of game strategy. Should be able to play 5-1 and 6-2 formations, have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike.

. If you'd like to play, please send an email to Alan  using the following URL:

http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=186541038

In the email, confirm that you know how to play in a 5-1 or 6-2 offense, and mention your preferred position (if any)


Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters, and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well.


The location for this volleyball meetup is at the

results.description:
Let's continue discussing "The Bond Book" by Annette Thau; we'll aim to get through chapters 7-8 this time.


Annette Thau is a former municipal bond analyst for Chase Manhattan Bank and a visiting scholar at the Columbia University Graduate School of Business. You may have seen her articles in AAII Journal. The Bond Book is written specifically for the individual investor, with clear writing, prudent insight, and easy mathematics.

All are welcome, even if you have no investing experience or have not read the book. We usually use highlights of the book as a general framework for discussion but topics often vary. Our goal is to learn together. All levels of investing experience are welcome. We look forward to seeing you there!

results.description:
Part 4 (Final event for spring '16)

Intermediate track: web development (JavaScript)


This course is progressive, so if you haven't attended the first 2 weeks, it could be tough to catch up (depending on your kids’ previous experience with these languages). 

When signing up, please indicate the number of kids you will be bringing. For example, if you are bringing one child, please RSVP "Just Me". If you are bringing two kids, please RSVP "+1". Accurate headcounts are very helpful for planning purposes, and help us deliver the best learning experience possible.


Prerequisites: Kids should have completed a Scratch (or Scratch equivalent) programming course, and be comfortable with basic programming concepts. Weeks 3 and 4 assume prior knowledge of HTML/CSS (from previous weeks).

What to bring: Laptop (+ charger) with a text editor for coding installed. I recommend Sublime Text 3 (it’s free to try indefinitely). Notepad++ is another good option. 

Location: We’ll be at the LogMeIn office in Seaport. The address is 320 Summer Street, Boston 02210. Map: https://goo.gl/maps/vMvDj. There should be some street parking (bring quarters) as well as a few lots in the area. The nearest T stop is South Station.

Note: We're always looking for mentors, and also non-technical volunteers. If you’re interested in helping out, let us know at [masked], or sign up for the Mentor Mailing List.
