results.description:
This How to Create an Event orientation is intended to walk current -- and future -- PGN leaders through the mechanics of actually creating an offering on PGN. 


If you are thinking about offering PGN members a social event, a practice group, or a workshop, take this workshop.

(A separate orientation deals with the rationale, philosophy, strategy, and practicalities of becoming a leader in the personal growth community.)

Topics

- Timing 
- Creating a title
- Writing copy 
- Targeting
- Seeding 
- Communicating
- PGN style

A Bit About Leadership on PGN

PGN leaders are members of PGN who offer social, practice, or workshop events on PGN.  PGN leaders create over 200 events a year.  

One of the main goals of the Personal Growth Network is to identify and support members who can create personal growth events for the community -- to help them become leaders.

Any member of PGN may offer an event on PGN, sharing their journey, their gifts, their joy, their successes, their vision, or their interests with like-hearted PGN members. 

PGN offers such leaders a toolbox of software, of coaching, and of support to help create successful events that benefit themselves and the membership.

For seasoned leaders, this is an important overview.  Newness can be a bit confusing initially.  (After all, the "growth" is in our name is also for professional growth.)  Some leaders, already with decades of experience, come to PGN with their own ideas about what has worked for them in the past and with definite ideas about what they expect PGN to do for them.  It benefits seasoned leaders to take a bit of time to grow into the new opportunities. 

Potential leaders have less to unlearn.  Any member thinking about maybe creating an event to offer to the personal growth community can find PGN a very powerful and empowering vehicle.  You just need to learn how to utilize the the toolbox, the support, and the community.

About the Personal Growth Network

A MetaOrganizer
The Personal Growth Network is a first-of-its-kind personal growth meta-organizer, bringing together diverse personal growth and positive psychology tools and techniques that are intended to help generally healthy people create greater joy and more success in all parts of their life. 

Via PGN, members can sample numerous approaches; they can select some approaches for more in-depth study; they can practice the approach sufficiently to impact their life in their desired direction; they can share their journey with other members, supporting one another; and, when they are complete with that phase of their growth, they can utilize PGN to find and explore a different approach or to refocus on a different part of their life. 

A Community
PGN is also a community of like-hearted people who share an important, but not widely distributed, combination of values and characteristics (e.g., curiosity, willingness to learn, willingness to change habits, humility). These values not only help members to consciously and proactively craft a life well-lived, they are a way of experiencing the world, a way that is not widely shared in the general population.

Engaging with other members of this community can be fascinating, supportive, and affirming for people who otherwise might believe that they are "odd" for having this important, extraordinary, and admirable combination of core values and characteristics.

(To see if you share these characteristics, take our ten-question questionnaire.)

A Toolbox
And finally, PGN is a toolbox with which members can create events that support themselves and other members in the community. Members can create workshops, practice groups, and social events. Organizers might be trained, or they may have deep passion, or they may just want to share their journey, their gifts, their joys, their successes, their vision, or their interests.

For these "leaders" in our community, PGN provides software, training, and support, and respectful access to the core people in the personal growth community who may be interested in joining them in their gifts.

About the Orientation Series

Given the enormous ambition and power of the Personal Growth Network, and its rapid growth, it is easy to feel a little overwhelmed at first, so we offer some "How-To" guides to maximize your utilization of the Personal Growth Network for whatever your goals may be.  

Our Orientations Include

For Participants 

- Thu Jun 16: Newbie Introduction 
. . . (For new, infrequent, or curious members) 

- Tues May 31: User's Guide 
. . . (For active members of PGN) 
. . . . . (Tentatively repeated on Thu Jul 28)

- Thu Jun 30: Advanced User's Guide 
. . . (For reducing emails and focusing on your growth areas) 
. . . . . (Tentatively repeated on Wed Sep 7)


For Leaders 

- Mon Aug 1: Intro to PGN Leadership 
. . . (For members considering offering events) 

- Thu Sept 1: Create an Event on PGN 
. . . (For members ready to offer an event) 

- Sun May 15: Build Your Brand 
. . . (For leaders who want to build an identity.) 
. . . . . (Tentatively repeated on Thu Sept 29) 

For a list of all upcoming orientations:
- - > http://www.meetup.com/Personal-Growth-Network/messages/boards/thread/49755315/0/#[masked]

About This Particular Orientation:

There is no prerequisite to take this orientation, although it may be very useful to have taken the User's Guide orientation and the Intro to Leadership orientation.

The natural follow-up to this orientation is the Build your Brand orientation.

This orientation is conceived for new or potential leaders who ready to offer events on PGN.  

I will also try to address any specific questions that you post below. 

About The Webinar Technology:

This Orientation is offered as a "Zoom Webinar".  It allows us to share screens and to see and hear one another. 

You will need a computer, and you will need to be in a location where you can listen and watch without distractions.  (There will be opportunities for open discussion as well, so you may want to look presentable. ) 

Zoom runs on most platforms.  If you have not run it before, please click on the link a half-hour before to ensure that it is working on your system.

The link will be sent to you the day before the event.
results.how_to_find_us: This Webinar is in the comfort of your home, with your computer and pen and paper. Please sign on at least ten minutes beforehand if you have never experienced a Zoom webinar.
results.name: PGN_Orientation: How to Create an Event on PGN

results.description:
The Boston Shambhala LGBT Meditation Group offers a safe space for those who identify as queer, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, or questioning to come together to explore the practice of meditation and support each other in community.  Previous meditation experience is not required.


This Sunday we will explore the transformative nature of meditation as a way of understanding the role challenges play as fuel for turning practice into a path. 


Mary Lang is senior teacher in the Shambhala tradition.  As a lifelong student of the dharma, Mary has a strong understanding of Buddhism, and brings humor and compassion to her skillful teaching style.  


This special evening will conclude with a festive social gathering in the Community Room. We invite you to bring something for the refreshments table to share with the group at the close of the program.
results.name: Shambhala LGBTQ Meditation Group

results.description:
Program: Bach & Beer
Musicians: Steuart Pincombe, cello

http://static1.squarespace.com/static/559ad05ae4b04990389c1d69/t/56fbf78bd210b88a1494b94c/1459353521183/?format=500w

Tickets: at the door, name-your-own-ticket price. Plus the cost of beer.

While sipping on their favorite brews at Aeronaut Brewing audience members will discover the connections between the art of brewing and the art of playing the music of Bach. Just as many brewers follow a recipe that was used hundreds of years ago, Steuart's approach to playing Bach also looks back on old “recipes” and methods of playing. The program of Bach’s Cello Suites will be interlaced with short explanations of Steuart’s historical, interpretive approach along with comments on the historical brewing method of each beer. Each Suite will be paired with one of Aeronaut’s own brews.
results.name: Aeronaut Brewing - Bach & Beer

results.description:
GRAB YOUR CLUBS….PLAY WHERE THE PROS PLAYED[LG1] ! Blue Hill Country Club
Designed in 1925 by Eugene Wogan, the 18-hole Championship Course located in Canton, MA. has fully matured into a golfer’s haven. Picturesque tree-lined fairways and lush, rolling terrain makes every golf outing an unforgettable experience. Known for its playability, Blue Hill Country Club hosted the 1956 PGA Championship and was the home course for the PING/Welch’s Championship on the LPGA Tour from 1991-1997. MONDAY – MAY 9th
9:00 A.M. SHOTGUN START… PLAY YOUR OWN BALL!
Luncheon to Follow in Clubhouse Open to Guests…… Men and Women

results.description:
Let's go for a private group tour of the of special collections, seasonal highlights, and history of Arnold Arboretum led by a knowledgeable docent.  The lilacs should be in full bloom!

The tour is a 1.5 hour guided walking tour, from 10-11:30 am. The date is Monday, May 9th.  The cost is $12.00.

Tour runs rain or shine.  No refunds given.  Tour will depart at 10 am promptly.

For those Taking the T:

Please be at  either Forest Hills Gate BEFORE 10 am, or at Forest Hills T by 9:45 am at the latest so we have time to walk over to meet the guide.  Lea Anne and Susan will be at the Forest Hills T Station to meet those using the T.  We will then walk on Washington Street and then Arborway/Rt 203 to the Forest Hills Gate.  I’ve attached a link for the Arboretum Map.  The T station is marked on there. http://arboretum.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/basic-map-b+w.pdf 

For those Driving to the Arboretum:

The address of the South Street gate is 387 South St., Boston.  The GPS coordinates are N42 degrees[masked] and W071 degrees 07.250.  If you are in the right spot you will see this sign.  There is parking in front of the gate.  Please either proceed to the Forest Hills Gate before 10 am, or meet us at the T by 9:45 am.  

It is a 10 minute walk from the Forest Hills T stop.  We will meet at the Forest Hills Gate by 10 am.  Directions here:

http://www.arboretum.harvard.edu/visit/directions/


For those wishing to have lunch, we will organize a lunch close by after our tour.  Everyone will be paying separately for the lunch.  Let us know if you are interested.

An e-mail with all of the final details will be sent to all participants a few days before the event.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at either Forest Hills Gate BEFORE 10 am, or at Forest Hills T by 9:45 am.
results.name: Walking tour of Arnold Arboretum and lunch

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Monday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Let's go for a brisk hike in the the Fells. We plan to hike 3 to 5 miles, approx 1.5-2 hours. The route is TBD and may include steep or rough terrain.


*This is a fitness hike rather than a stroll in the woods.* To keep pace with the group, you should be able to walk a 2.5 mile per hour pace on the trail (which is significantly slower than walking on the road.)


You will need to wear good trail shoes and layers to adjust for temperature change. We will meet at the Long Pond parking area on South Border Rd off Mystic Valley Pkway. Arrive a few minutes early - we leave promptly at 5:15pm.


http://www.getupngoadventures.com/html/south_border_road.html

Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow theHike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

results.description:
HIGH-RISE stars Tom Hiddleston (I Saw the Light, Crimson Peak, Thor, Only Lovers Left Alive) as Dr. Robert Laing, the newest resident of a luxurious apartment in a high-tech concrete skyscraper whose lofty location places him amongst the upper class. Laing quickly settles into high society life and meets the building's eccentric tenants: Charlotte (Sienna Miller), his upstairs neighbor and bohemian single mother; Wilder (Luke Evans), a charismatic documentarian who lives with his pregnant wife Helen (Elisabeth Moss); and Mr. Royal (Jeremy Irons), the enigmatic architect who designed the building. Life seems like paradise to the solitude-seeking Laing. But as power outages become more frequent and building flaws emerge, particularly on the lower floors, the regimented social strata begins to crumble and the building becomes a battlefield in a literal class war. High-Rise is the latest film by cult British director Ben Wheatley (Kill List, Sightseers, Down Terrace), adapted from the J.G. Ballard novel by screenwriter Amy Jump.

HIGH-RISE opens Friday, May 13 at Landmark's Kendall Square Cinema. The film's running time is 119 minutes and it is Rated R. https://youtu.be/1g6izQcDNNA
results.name: High-Rise   5-9  Mon.    Kendall Sq.  7 PM

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
